Reviews.Title: “Average...but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: teamRR
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here over St. Pat's Weekend w/ 2 kids. We chose this hotel because it was close to what we wanted to see (Aquarium, Chinatown, Art Museum). In that regard, it didn't disappoint. 10 minute walk to the Aquarium, 5 minute walk to the subway station, 15 minute walk to the Art Museum. It really is a great location for the lower Michigan Drive attractions. There were 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 kids in a room with 2 double beds. The room was standard, nothing more. The room was clean and the bedding and towels were well laundered and comfortable. Decor, TV, and lighting, were all out dated and in need of functional & decorative upgrades. The beds were not very comfortable and also felt like they needed to be upgraded. The walls and doors are VERY THIN. You can very clearly hear conversations in the hallway, even at normal speaking volume, so that was certainly a problem. In the middle of our first night the electricity in the room went out. When I called the front desk, they were polite and helpful, and I got the sense that they had experienced this frequently from their response. The did, however fix the problem promptly and followed up to make sure, which was appreciated it. Our tub also had a very, very slow drain. To the point that the water was up to my wive's lower calf while taking a shower. When we informed the front desk, they were apologetic and polite, and offered to let us keep our car in their garage a few extra hours so we could explore the city more before leaving town. Overall, the hotel was OK. We had problems to deal with, and the staff was at least helpful in getting them resloved, maybe not over the top helpful, but they did get the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffani C
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, it was clean and nice. Our son enjoyed the pool. The people working were friendly. There wasn't anything special about the hotel, but it was a great value for staying in Chicago. I think they could upgrade their TV channels though. I've stayed in much cheaper hotels and they at least had cable.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my aunt for 1 night in Sept of '10. We had already stayed at a nearby hotel and were glad to move on to another hotel, but not too far as we had some luggage to carry. Found this place online and booked it the day before arrival. It is an older building with a simple outdated interior. We checked in early to our first room but the bathroom had a leaky faucet which we knew waas going to drive us nuts at night. Went to ask for another room and since there was only 1 person working the desk at the time, she was busy with a group that just checked in so we had a bit of a wait..oh well. Luckily there was a room available and it was better but like the rest very basic. It is a Best Western after all. Nothing particularly good or bad about the second room. For the price we knew what to expect. Location was good as it was not far from where we needed to go and what we needed to do. May stay here again as a last option.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great...Service Bummer”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Mommy27
Reviews.Content: The Location of the Best Western you cannot beat, hands down perfect location. The Service in the housekeeping department was definately lacking, Hotel could definately use some much needed upkeep, pool was closed & nothing mentioned at check in nor did the Managment decide to go above & beyond & notify any guests BEFORE Their arrivals...not impressed...

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to take a quick vacation to Chicago around Christmas for some shopping and fun. Not wanting to spend too much money so close to the Holidays, I searched for a reasonable priced, good location hotel. Best Western Grant Park met out needs. While this hotel may not be the prettiest in Chicago; the staff was awesome and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: moscovite2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice location. Only 10 min walk to Chicago Art Institute and other sights. But rooms and equipment are too old! I have chenged rooms twice, because heaters were too noisy as on a plant! I could not sleep at all! And finally I got quiet room, but I got freezing every night. Stuff was very friendly, but this hotel REALLY needs RENOVATION! It ned to be fixed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms perfect for my short weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: emmki
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Grant Park is located perfectly on S. Michigan Av, a short walk to most tourist sites, close by to lots of good restaurants & breakfast places. A short 1 minute walk across the road finds you I Grant Park. It's probably about a 20 minute walk up to Millennium Park but easy enough to get the L train straight up which cuts the journey down to about 5/10 minutes. (nearest station to the hotel is Roosevelt, just round the corner) Rooms were a little dated but clean enough & just what I needed for the weekend. Good to note for breakfast is Yolk, also on Michigan Av & almost next door to the hotel. Their breakfast menu was amazing with great service and amazing food. Coffee here was also lovely. On the street behind the hotel is Eleven Diner which has an all day breakfast menu. Food here was also great & kept me going for the rest of the day! Hotel is great value for money for its position.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Peterpevers
Reviews.Content: Last October my wife and I decided to take a short vacation but couldn't find any deals down south, so we opted for a city vacation in Chicago. We definitely fell in love with the city and would recommend Chicago to anyone for its walkability and many attractions (museums, landmarks, restaurants, etc.). While in Chicago, we stayed at the Best Western Grant Park Hotel. For the money, it offered us the best location (walking distance from the waterfront, public transit, and several museums). It's a Best Western, not a Fairmont, so don't expect the world but the room was clean, check-in and check-out were without incident, and the location was awesome. If anything, we could only complain about the fact that accessing the Internet from their lobby-based computers was next to useless (slow!!). Some people may be put off by some of the noise from the above-ground rail system but hey...that's Chicago (and thank goodness for the train's close proximity since it took us from/to the airport). Being downtown has its perks. There are also many diners, pharmacies, and supermarkets in the general area. At the Grant Park, you're never far from any of the essential amenities. I would definitely stay there again and if you're bigger on practicality than luxury, then the Grant Park is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Megeara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the older side, but very clean and well taken care of. Easy access to the major Chicago attractions (Field Museum, Soldier Field, Art Institute, Magnificent Mile). TV was broken when I turned it on the first night and the front desk sent someone up to fix it right away. I would recommend staying here. Only problem I could see is that the train tracks are fairly close, I couldn't hear the trains and had no problems sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Business trip - convention @ the Hilton. Two blocks from the Hilton and paid less than half the Hilton discounted convention rate. Near Depaul and other universities. Lots of restaurants, shops and businesses within easy walking distance. Can take the Metro from Midway Airport to stop 1 block away for about $3 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Pearl_McG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Cubs convention and man was I happy I chose this place. Not only did we get a killer deal, we were treated very well. The hotel was 150.00 less than the Hilton per night and only 2 blocks away. It is small and narrowly built hotel so the hallways and elevators were also small and narrow. Not a bad thing but definitely not something I'd want to encounter if the place was packed. The room we had, 725 was basic but nice. Queen bed, TV, 3 lamps table and chair for furniture. No refrigerator or microwave, the latter I would have liked but it was no big deal. The bathroom was small but my tall husband was very happy to have a shower head that was set so high up on the wall and had piping hot water flowing. There were some signs the place has some age, there were repair marks on the shower and curtains although clean were a little dated pattern wise. Again, an observation but far from a complaint. We ate breakfast at the restaurant there twice and had the breakfast sandwiches to go one day as well. The staff in the morning was pleasant and friendly, checking on us often and making sure we didn't have dirty plates hanging out on the table. We really had a great night one Saturday when we wandered in for a couple of drinks. That choice turned out to be our best choice of that day. The manager on Thaddeus was so great! He chatted with us about the city and things to do and even let us try some of the local Goose Island beer on tap because we were curious. The other staff on duty, Zachary as well as another waiter all came over to see how we were and made us feel so darn welcome. We were sitting at the bar about 3 hours talking and enjoying the company of the staff. There's service and then there's entertainment, that night we got both. We were sad to know they weren't going to be en the next evening, our last there. Now location can't be beat for this hotel. A frozen 15 minute walk through Grant Park and we were at the doors of the Shedd Aquarium and the rest of the Museum Campus along with a really nice view of Navy Pier and the skyline. Going the opposite way we visited Millennium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago. We were also about 10 minutes away from the red line entrance. There is a bus stop right outside the main door too. All in all this place was good for the price and we were really pleased to have stayed there. We are already planning on staying there again when we go back to Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for Inexpensive Stay Near Museums and Lake Michigan”
Reviews.Author: RichardJewell
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Grant Park Hotel was low-priced (if you look for a deal online); so, as expected, you could see its age showing through in places. However, our two rooms were absolutely clean, the front desk service and the maid service were excellent, and the manager, Octavio, went out of his way to fix a problem that we had with Priceline accidentally cancelling our reservation: he even made an even better reservation for us in case Priceline wouldn't honor its arrangement with us. The best thing about the hotel for us is that it was a 15-min. walk to the Art Institute of Chicago, our main reason for going to Chicago for four days, and ten minutes from the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and the Planetarium. The hotel is just across the street from a major park along Lake Michigan. And there are plenty of stores and restuarants of many kinds on the nearby major streets--Michigan, Wabash, and State. There also are a number of bus lines and L (Elevated--the subway/elevated train system that goes everywhere in Chicago). We felt very safe and protected in our rooms, too, because of the alertness and number of staff in the hotel at night. Our car also was locked behind behind a chain-link fence that was very secure. The only drawback was the cost of parking: $24 per 24-hr. day. But I checked parking in other hotel ramps, and theirs cost even more. This is the one thing I would check out more thoroughly before staying in that area again--a cheaper but just as secure parking area. There was, in fact, metered parking on the street in places, but that was only good for a few hours at a time. If you're staying for several days and not using your car, it might be possible, after dropping off your luggage, to park at a prearranged, much cheaper, and even more secure lot several miles away, then take the subway/elevated train or the bus back to the hotel. In all, though, we thought we got a great deal. We wanted an inexpensive and comfortable hotel, and we were very happy with the result. We will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: dviana
Reviews.Content: Near Soldier Field, Grant Park, museums and attractions. Great value for location. Rooms are just average. Skip the hotel breakfast and go to Yolk, just around the corner on S. Michigan ave. Don't miss it

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice location”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night with a Contiki tour. I usually stay Best Western so i was interested to see how this would be since it was a tour and usually the rooms are average. The room was nice, I slept well and there wasn't a whole heap of noise even with the lift right outside. There were vending machines right outside the room too which was good when you needed a drink. I ate dinner in the room, which was convenient since it was just downstairs in the hotel. There is an asian style restaurant and they have wraps and fruit too. I had sweet and sour chicken with rice. It was actually really good!!! I was really satisfied with that meal! Location is right across from the park obviously, and it isnt a long walk into the main area of Chicago, so you cant go wrong staying here. Wifi was good. Rooms were spacious and clean and i was impressed with this hotel, especially since the rates were quite high for a best western, but obviously the location and room standard is reason why. I would stay here again, and enjoyed my time here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Chicago for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: ManyConferences
Reviews.Content: There is no breakfast, no extras and you need to wear some blinders for the age and wear / tear of rooms could give you some concerns. Once over that, keep in mind the cost savings and location! A quick walk to the museums and transportation! The front desk is able to provide much helpful information and recommendations. They also honored my request for a room with a view (top floor) - right across from the park. We stayed two nights! We arrived early and our room was not ready. However, they took our cell number and held our luggage - steered us in the direction we needed to go and called us when the room was ready, We did not waste time waiting for our room nor did we need to tote luggage around. Very helpful! Even gave us a few hints with regard to the museums (late hours, lines, ietc.)Each morning we would go down to the eatery enclosed with the hotel for coffee and a roll. It was convenient! We plan to stay at this hotel again! Wish the rooms were in better shape but that is the worse I can say! It was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Value on Michigan without te glitz and glamour”
Reviews.Author: mattnmary99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on south Michigan avenue. Great value for the location. There isn't anything exceptionally remarkable about the hotel but my expectations were met. We stayed there the night of te lighting of the magnificent mile and had a great time and were able to walk anywhere. For the money the room was satisfactory. Nothing more. Nothing less. And be advised that this hotel is close to soldier field and thus very busy saturday night before Bears home games - usually full of the opposing teams fans!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: het
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near museums and good restaurants. The Field Museum is a ten minute walk away on the other side of Grant Park. There is a CTA station on Roosevelt, about a 5 minute walk. We didn't try Mei's Kitchen located next to the hotel but liked Yolk for breakfast, half a block south on Michigan Ave. The hotel itself is a little worn around the edges but was clean and very quiet, if you don't mind some music from Columbia College across the street. It was never noisy at night. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We had a view that included the Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. All in all, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Really pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: piet51
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled so much of tobacco we asked right away to move. We were accommodated the next day, and the staff was cooperative. The rooms are very bare bones and the hotel is quite shabby. The rooms are clean. In the first room, the sink faucet did not dispense cold water. There's plenty of hot water however! The curtains in the second room did not work. Considering what hotels cost in Chicago, which is a bit of a mystery, more expensive than Washington, DC and several European cities, it's a reasonable alternative, but really way too worn. There's an excellent Italian restaurant, Gioco, within walking distance, and a Trader Joe. The restaurant next door isn't bad, but the service is slow. Yolk further on was much better. There are Michigan Avenue buses right outside and views of the Field Museum. It's an OK location if you're not looking for night life. Taxis are also very expensive. I'm giving the hotel two stars because the staff tried to be helpful. But did that room stink! And I have a $25 charge I have to dispute. There's no refrigerator so no bar charges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Petros007
Reviews.Content: We did a week-long anniversary / fun with toddler trip. You could spend much more for a swankier hotel but we found this place to be the best combination of value, cleanliness and hospitality in downtown Chicago. It is within walking distance of Grant Park and also pretty close to Chinatown on the south side as well. It's not as modern looking as some other hotels but it seems reasonably well kept (although there was some construction on our floor during our stay). All of the people behind the desk were very friendly and helpful. We weren't that impressed with the attached restaurant (so many other places with better food and value in Chicago). Parking was $24 / day which isn't cheap but I guess pretty good relative to location and other nearby hotels. Great location and value overall, well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Downtown/Grant Park”
Reviews.Author: Mostin8
Reviews.Content: Booking online, we were able to get a great rate for this hotel, about $135/night for a three-day, two-night weekday trip to Chicago. It was the best rate I could find in the area, and on-site, secured valet parking with unlimited in/out privileges was $24/night (also the lowest in the area). A lot of the other reviews mentioned finding street or other paid lot parking nearby, but we made a few trips around the block and didn't find any parking options where we felt comfortable leaving our vehicle for a few days, so we forked out the extra $24/night. I think it was worth it. The check-in process was quick. There were several people in front of us but there were two young women working the computers and they made an effort to take care of everyone efficiently. We requested a lake view room and they set us up in a king room that was just the ticket. It was VERY spacious compared to your typical Chicago hotel room - but that's because the room was a barrier-free (read: handicapped accessible) room. I don't know how we were able to get this room but it was great! The bathroom was enormous and the view was beautiful. The bedding/drapes definitely need an upgrade but other than that the room was clean and pretty darn nice. Vending/ice on every other floor, great air conditioning... the only issue worth mentioning is the slow and tiny elevator with a strange smell haha. Some people have certain thoughts about the Grant Park area - we had friends telling us not to walk around our hotel at night. Of course you should always be aware of your surroundings, especially in a city like Chicago, but we thought their concerns were a little bogus, as we never felt unsafe. The hotel was super close to the CTA/Metra station and we could get anywhere in the city quickly and cheaply! We went to a White Sox game, the Sears (or Willis) Tower, etc. and it was all so easy and accessible from the hotel location. The best part about staying at the Best Western Grant Park? Yolk is just around the corner! Everything there is excellent and they are open for breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodable, Extra-Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jay T
Reviews.Content: I would like to personally thank all the staff at The Best Western Grant Park for making my stay in Chicago a memorable and very enjoyable one. I was in Chicago for The Men's Health Urbanathlon and wanted a room close to downtown and close to amenities. This is definitely the place. When I called to book a room, the only room they had left was on a smoking floor but even though the hallway smelled faintly of smoke, our room did not and that was a pleasant surprise. The room itself was a little dated but the bed had down pillows, down comforter and mattress was new...that's about all I needed and worried about. The room still was quite satisfactory. Front desk staff and bell staff very amazing. Particularly, my friend "Octavio" was quite the ambassador for the hotel and the city of Chicago. This gentleman made every effort to make sure we got exactly what we wanted. We even decided on a whim to stay an extra night and he not only worked it so that we could, he ensured us an even better rate than we were paying for the previous nights. I take my hat off to all staff...couldn't have asked for better people. Instead of run in New York or San Francisco next year, we will be going back to Chicago and mainly because of our great experience. You will not be disappointed here...and let's be honest, when you are in Chicago you should be out enjoying the city, not sitting in your room on Best Western's free wifi complaining about how your TV isn't a flat screen. Every pub I went to had one so go check theirs out! LOL. Thanks Best Western Grant Park!

Reviews.Title: “On business, skip this hotel! Poor customer service and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a good location, but for the $190 a night I am paying, just not worth it. The rooms were updated years and years ago. The restaurant, like the exercise room, doesn't open till 7AM. And to make matters even worse, the exercise room is located on the only smoking floor. I used to smoke and have no problems with "smokers", but do I have to smell it (heavily) while I work out? And their reason for why they don't open the exercise room till 7? Too much noise. Yet it doesn't seem to bother them that their ice makers sound like mini lear jets trying to take off! I can hear it 8 rooms away. I also had to call down to get the wireless connection code. I called four times, each letting it ring 20 times or so. Finally I went down to the front desk. Surprise, two people standing there. One finishing up with a customer. I asked why she couldn't have picked up the phone (which was ringing again) and say "front desk, please hold". She seemed shocked that I would expect such customer service. I also NEVER took my socks off, which should tell you how dirty the room is, yuk! Skip this hotel! I found another independent hotel one block away, next time that is where our staff stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special, Nothing Bad”
Reviews.Author: fronya
Reviews.Content: A very convenient little hotel that is close to the downtown core, very close to the wonderful waterfront parks and is close to the subway system. We had no problems travelling from the airport to here (requires one change) and there is also a grocery store nearby and some restaurants (though nightlife is a little further away). The room was clean and neat, but is a little small if you're used to bigger and roomier types of rooms. The doors are a little thin in terms of noise reduction but this was never issue. Overall, a very good room that's convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: KimJorg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful- We had to stay here because the Essex where the rest of our staff was staying was sold out by the time we booked our rooms. The room doors feel like prison doors and the hotel overall was dirty and a little scary. One morning the power went off for almost hour and the staff acted like they couldve cared less at the inconvenience this caused us trying to get ready and out the door for a work convention we were attending. Over all we were incredibly dissatisfied and will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kate57_10
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised. The hotel could use some updating but putting that aside our stay turned out to be quite enjoyable. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The location is great, especially for the price. Close to Milleneum Park. We liked the fact that it was also close to Trader Joes and Buddy Guys on Wabash. We left our car at the hotel and got the CTA Day fun pass. Great for getting around the city. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: starmanlars
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel right across the street from Grant Park. Great location to many downtown destinations. Staff was very helpful. On site parking for a fee is a good idea because of its location you can walk or find an L train or the subway only blocks away which can vurtually take you anywhere in the city. Soldier Field, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Grant Park and Cloud Gate are just a short distance walk from hotel. Navy Pier is just over a mile walk too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Miyoko
Reviews.Content: My daughter (18 years old) and I went to Chicago for a short getaway-August 23-26. Stayed at the BW Grant Park for three nights. We had a great time! This hotel is on the main drag - Michigan Ave- along the lake. Close to everything! Nice running/walking /biking trail right along the lake and beautiful gardens and fountains there too. saw fireworks one night from our window. Few minutes walk to the Field Museum (natural history), aquarium, and planetarium. About a 20min walk to the Art Institute and Cloud Gate. The hotel itself was fine. It's an older hotel- some might find the bathrooms and elevators small but everything was very clean and the front desk staff were very helpful. Good location and value. Beds a little soft. Internet service was very slow and one day I had a problem connecting. Someone came right away and brought a cable to plug directly into the router in the room so then service was a little faster.Did not visit the pool. Ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant every day. They have a hot and cold buffet and a take out counter as well. Not too many restaurants in the neighborhood as it seems to be in transition with a lot of new high rise condos going up all around. We found a good restaurant on the next street, Eleven City Diner, with good food and cakes to die for! There is also a good brunch place next door, Yolk, but we did not eat there. Big grocery store also on the next street with the weird name of Jewel-Osco where we bought fruit, snacks and sandwiches. We took the El from O'Hare Airport- blue line, then two stops on the red line. Roosevelt station is 5 minutes walk from the hotel and the entire trip costs $2.25 (takes about one hour). We got Chicago Go passes for three days to visit the sights. We went to the natural history museum, planetarium, aquarium, Art institute, Contemporary art museum, and took the Architectural boat tour. All highly recommended esp. boat tour and jellyfish exhibit at the aquarium. Another perk of having the pass was using the Hop on hop off bus tour which took us from location to location which has a stop at the Hilton nearby the Best Western. Great trip, will have to go back again. Chicago is a beautiful city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: wonderfalk
Reviews.Content: A great value! Excellent location, very friendly staff. Bed was not king size as reservation stated, but that is really the only negative thing I have to say. Nice view from room. Very reasonable parking. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: wmckenzie11
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from August 1-4, 2011 our room was clean, bed was very comfortable, plenty of hot water for showers since three of us were taking them at the same time. Staff were helpful in the CTA information and you are very near locations to pick them up. Grocery store, Walgreens, Mexican and Italian restaurant near watch for daily specials we got a taco dinner for $5.00 and "Yolk" for breakfast beware they give you alot. We wanted a hotel with an outdoor pool and it was fine the pool area could need some painting and new furnture but we enjoyed our swim after coming in from our shopping and sightseeing. I have stayed at Best Western North, Embassy Suites, and The James hotel in downtown Chicago my favorite is Grant Park nice staff, great location and a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi did not work!”
Reviews.Author: soederman
Reviews.Content: Everything fine except that the internet did not work in our room. Had to go down to the lobby to get it working (still annoyingly slow speed)

Reviews.Title: “Here for Lolapalooza”
Reviews.Author: HG305
Reviews.Content: This place looks ugly. The hallways look terrible. If it wasn't because of spending these nights with my friends, I'd kill myself.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but worn”
Reviews.Author: NSimenas
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were friendly, funny and competant-- very pleasant and gave us an upgrade without asking. We had a complicated set of family reservations, via orbitz, and everything worked out, despite changes. One thing to watch out for: parking. the valet parking fills up and you have to park at the condos next door (which could fill up too). We heard one patron with a uHaul saying "I called four times to check if you had room with enough clearance!" as he sat stranded in the middle of chicago. The pool is small and outdoors. The restaurant is nothing to write home about although again, the staff is friendly. The rooms are pretty old and one had a strange smell. They are bigger than, say the nearby Travelodge and about the same age and mileage.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal”
Reviews.Author: domare
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was recommended by my son's college. We were going to Chicago for a college orientation and the Best Western was blocks from the college. It was very convenient. The price was very reasonable and the reservation went smoothly. The room was small and a bit on the shabby side. It was difficult to adjust the air conditioning so the room was either very cold or too warm. The hotel only had 2 computers available for guests and they were usually taken. Once I had access to the computer, I found it to be very slow and the printer was not working. When I mentioned it to the desk clerk, she said, "Oh, just shut it off and turn it back on again and it will work. It always does that". I was trying to print my boarding pass and the printer was of such poor quality that the document was not legible. It is unlikely that I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: TOTLCOM
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Best Western Grant Park while at a business conference. The conference was 3 short blocks away at the Chicago Hilton Hotel (very nice). However my room was 1/3 less expensive, the air conditioner worked (Hilton had problems) and I had a wonderful view of Soldier Park and Lake Michigan. Ask for room 801. It is not huge, but the view is worth it. Hint: From O'Hare, take the Blue Line subway to Jackson, then a bus to the hotel. Total cost only $2.25 and it is faster than driving. Microwave and refrigerator are in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when visiting our son at Columbia College”
Reviews.Author: mbfuller
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is quite basic, we always stay here when visiting our son at college in Chicago. The location can't be beat--and the price for the value is the best we've found. Internet is free, parking is only $24 and we can walk or bus anywhere we need to go. The Museum Campus is literally across the street. Yolks is right next door! We have stayed at the Hilton just down the street for more money, then were charged $12 a night for internet, $50 a night for parking and received blase' service. The rooms are basic but clean, and the one time our room was less than satisfactory we were moved at once.

Reviews.Title: “The location was decent, but if we had to do it over, we'd pay extra to stay elsewhere downtown.”
Reviews.Author: hannahb426
Reviews.Content: There are only two positive things I can think of to mention about this place: the service and the air conditioning unit in the room. Upon arrival, we were treated very nicely. There was a pretty long wait to check in, but once we got to the counter, the staff was helpful and friendly. Unfortunately, we were told that there was no more parking in their garage, so we had to park in a garage that was a few blocks down the street. We found this a bit ridiculous, since we had booked our room 2 days in advanced and they should be prepared for the amount of people they have staying here. Be prepared for this expense, because we paid $44 for parking for a total of 48 hours in that garage. The hotel is clearly geared towards catering to families, and by that I mean there were families and children everywhere, and screaming babies in several of the rooms next to ours. As we were on a bit of a romantic trip, this put a damper on our stay. There are only two very small elevators, meaning that you're usually waiting for an elevator, and once you get on one, you're crammed in there with a several other people. The doors to the rooms don't go all the way down to the floor (there's a good one inch gap) so you can hear everything that's going on out in the hallway. The rooms themselves are quite small and old. The bathroom was very small and didn't have a vent. Our bedding didn't look very clean (there were questionable stains on the comforter). The bed overall was quite uncomfortable. All in all, we wish we would have only booked one night here so that we could have spent our second night at a different hotel downtown. We really felt like the $120 we paid didn't go that far.

Reviews.Title: “Central location walk to most everything.”
Reviews.Author: BENTOGTAON
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, well kept building. about half the rates for all other hotels facing (or near ) Michigan Ave. About five minute walk to all big stores, Millenium Park (the Bean) Navy Pier, Museums and schools.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you need a place to sleep near Museum Campus”
Reviews.Author: umgabri2
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights here at a rate below what the other hotels with pool in the area were charging. They advertise having valet parking, but they don't have enough spaces; I was told my options were public garages a half block away or two blocks away. It was an inconvenience having to park the car and walk back to the hotel, but at least I was able to unload and reload my luggage while in front of the hotel. The staff was very friendly. Though some of the furnishings were old and parts of the curtain were fallen from its hooks, the room was comfortable and had everything I needed, with a great view of Grant Park and Lake Michigan. Unfortunately, the wireless Internet only worked when I was beside the door, and even then speeds were very slow and I often had difficulty getting a signal even then. The air conditioner was quite loud. The outdoor pool was unheated and not very well filtered; I would have passed on swimming in it were it not a very hot day. I didn't bother with the restaurant as it seemed expensive. A little far from the Magnificent Mile, but a good place if you want to go to the Art Institute, the Aquarium, or the Planetarium.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, Charged twicw for our room”
Reviews.Author: angieudelhoven
Reviews.Content: We had to find our own parking becasue their parking garage was full and pay over $40 to park in unsecure parking lot. We were charged twice for the hotel and the price was extrememly inflated. When i checked in my total was 159.99 and when we checked out I was charged 234.04. Not what I was expecting. The pool was disgusting, the water was freezing, and the pool was only half full. We had no wash clothes in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about other reviews”
Reviews.Author: CSturgeo
Reviews.Content: Unless you are planning to spend a great deal of time in your room the Grant Park Hotel was fine. I was part of a group tour so , of course, the price was right. The room had everything we needed including a great view from rm. 904. The pillows others griped about must have been replaced and there wer THREE on each bed (we had 2). We had no noise problem and since I had read other reviews complaing about the thin walls I took some earplugs but never got them out of the package. We pulled up in a motorcoach of 4r people and our rooms were quickly assigned and the luggage was delivered very quickly. We had in included breakfast at Mei's Kitchen, the attached restaurant which was buffet style and OK. As to other meals the service can be slow. But a late night pizza just before they closed was promptly served. The location is very good EXCEPT for the miimal amount of places close by to dine. Head north for some better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable cost.”
Reviews.Author: DNLB
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly , courteous, and helpful. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. A good value on Michigan Avenue. Within walking distance to many attractions. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, cramped and lacking in amenities”
Reviews.Author: BengCh001
Reviews.Content: Hotel has valet parking and when we arrived they advised us that their lot was full but a spot should open up over the weekend. (it may have but we were never informed) Had to park in a nearby public lot. The hotel is located near the lake front and this was the best thing about the hotel, its location. The rooms were very dated, small and the walls were cardboard thin and we heard everything! The staff constantly asked us if everything was okay and it was ok but I felt like I was at Walmart when the cashier asks if you had any trouble finding anything because if you do they just smile at you and don't know what to do. I don't know what they would have done if I had complained about the noise next door because the people in that room weren't throwing a party but just having a conversation. If you need a reasonable place to sleep in the downtown area this is ok but just don't expect a great room or amenities, this isn't that kind of place. The attached restaurant is terrible beyond belief, stay away at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: RP_Bettendorf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night (a chilly May 18) after delivering our daughter to her summer internship. Room 517 was fine; Heater, TV, bathroom, and even the free wireless (once I called the tech support 800 number). I looked at the exercise room, and it was adequate. A very minor issue: No free coffee in the lobby, but the room had a small Mr. Coffee machine plus there's an adjacent restaurant. Also minor: The outdoor pool was empty (no water). We got the $127 internet rate. Add tax and the $24 valet parking and it came to a reasonable $171. If you're going to be staying in the hotel a lot, this might not be the place to stay, but for a quick overnight or a base of operations it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Lake/park view value”
Reviews.Author: outatouch0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an overnight sightseeing stop before visiting relatives. We requested and fortunately received a lake-view room. We were lucky to arrive on the only nice summer-like day to walk through the park and see a few sights. The hotel staff were exceptional and efficient. Check-in and Check-out was quick and easy. They stored our luggage after checkout so we could see a few more sights before leaving town. Location is very convenient. Very short walk from Orange & Red line stations as well as the MTA? and Shorline train station. We did this with our roll-along luggage in tow no problem. There are TA pictures posted of the room decor. Fortunately they ditched the beadspread that matches the drapes. Ours was white and the look and feel was much improved from the impression I had from the pictures. We almost did not stay here because of that but the value and location made it the right choice an we were not disappointed. The only downside to the room was the lack of an exhaust fan in the bathroom. Most of these hotels are in OLD buildings so there is little to be done for that. Other nearby hotels likely have the same issue. The adjoining restaurant was good (taste and value) for the limited lunch menu. However, the breakfast was not worth the price for the quality of the food. Would have been fine as a free breakfast only. We would not have minded the $10 each if the food quality & taste lived up to the price. Overall, we will stay here again if we manage to return to Chicago to see more sites around the area. A ton of stuff to see and do right out in front of the hotel that would take at least a week to cover it.

Reviews.Title: “No-Frills but reasonable, clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: DellsLocal
Reviews.Content: We needed a "home base" for our family of four while visiting Chicago as tourists. We weren't too picky and didn't want to pay the extra 55.00 a night some of the nicer hotels were charging for parking. This hotel worked out well, friendly staff, clean, and they gave us a room with a million dollar view. The room was small and the building is dated but you get what you pay for. We were within walking distance of tons of great places to eat, Marshall Field's (Macey's), the Field museum and the Art Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel deal in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PFMica
Reviews.Content: We wanted a Michigan Ave. hotel, but couldn't afford most of them, until we discovered Best Western's Grant Park Hotel. It's across from the southern end of Grant Park (directly across from the Agora public art project) which had been dicey in years past, but is now very safe for venturing out at night. It's a 20 minute walk up to the Art Institute & just a bit more to the Bean & Miracle Mile. The Field Museum & Shed Aquarium are within sight. Blues lovers will appreciate its proximity to Buddy Guys Legends (about 2 blocks north & one block over to Wabash). The Orange Line to Midway Airport is at Roosevelt, about a 4 blocks away. There's a cafe at street level that has fabulous food deals (like a $7 burger & fries), but the staff needs a lesson in service & courtesy (although the hotel staff are great). Ask for a room overlooking the lake & park. There's a cheaper park yourself lot a block away if you want to avoid their valet only parking. Book it on Expedia for an even better price.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but good finish.”
Reviews.Author: clooney10
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for a group of friends to stay over night in Chicago for a running race in Grant Park. The location was great for us to walk to and from the event. Although I booked the 2 rooms together and requested they be near each other or adjoining, the best the hotel could do was one floor apart. When we arrived at the hotel to check-in, one of the rooms was found with the door propped wide open with a towel, the entry light was burned out, and one of the beds was not made. This was concerning and not very promising. When we returned to the front desk, they were not able to accommodate a different room, but were able to offer to fix up the current room. While we were waiting in the lobby for our room to be 'fixed,' (at 8pm at night) we were offered some drinks at the bar and then given some vouchers for free buffet breakfast. When we returned to the room, everything seemed to be in order and the front desk followed up with us to make sure we were satisfied. We felt they had sufficiently made up for the inconvenience caused. There were limited parking spaces available on site at the hotel. The amount of spaces appeared to nowhere near accommodate the number of rooms in the hotel. When my friends and I arrived, the spaces were filled and we had to park a block and a half away in a public parking garage and walk back to the hotel with our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: dleathers
Reviews.Content: We traveled here as a family. Teenager and child. Great location. I can see Field Museum from my window. Small rooms (even "executive suites") Bad housekeeping though. Had to ask numerous times for more than one washcloth. Last day they didnt leave coffee. Left trashcan sitting on chair and much more. Rooms are small, but affordable (in general). They didn't tell us ahead of time that there is a $50 deposit for incidentals. Average and okay for a base of operations for a family touring the area. Metra station is right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to the loop for business”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting downtown and was looking for something cheap close to the loop. This hotel fits the bill. It is not fancy at all, but you can't beat the location, close to the loop and several subway lines. As with most downtown hotels, it can be noisy. The location is close to the subway line, so you will hear subway cars as well as street noise all night. You can also hear the doors and elevators of your neighbors in the hotel. You can park on the street pretty cheap. Overnight parking is actually free from 9:00 pm to 8:00 am, and then it is just $3 per hour otherwise. There are several good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very Different View of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Diane from WI
Reviews.Content: Having grown up in the Chicago area it was very interesting to stay in the South Loop Usually we opt for the River north/North Michigan Ave area but my husband was in town for a convention so we decided to try something further south towards McCormick Place. Great choice! The hotel is located right across from Grant Park and a short walk to the Museum complex. Or simply take the #3 bus up Michigan Ave to get to the Art Institute or the Magnificent Mile. We had a corner room with great views- room was very clean and bed comfortable. Best of all was the neighborhood- two of the TA rated top restaurants are literally around the corner from the hotel (Yolk and Eleven City Diner). The area is much quieter than the over commercialized River North. Lots of condos and lofts have been built along Wabash so the area has almost a neighborhood feel. (Contrasted with what it used to be like years ago) All and all we enjoyed a different view of Chicago and will stay there again as it really offers a great bang for the buck. Note: We did not drive but noticed that there was lots of inexpensive parking lots along Wabash ($5-$7 per day)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: Pierre1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights for business conference. It is located in good location, the staff were helpful and friendly when I arrived very late at night. Is the hotel the Ritz? No! But it was a decent, clean enough place that permitted me to warm up, take a hot shower, sleep in a very comfortable bed, and wake up refreshed and ready to tackle Chicago. My only complaint may be that when it is rather cold (was around 28 degrees F), the heat in the room struggles to keep the room warm, without it running constantly--it was a little drafty next to the windows. But I don't sleep next to the windows! So all in all, I would recommend it if you are attending convention, etc. i would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me!”
Reviews.Author: shiredawn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine. Nothing fancy, no complaints. Clean, staff was helpful, internet didn't work, but we used an unsecured link instead of the Best Western one and it worked. Ate at the attached restaurant for breakfast and everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all around”
Reviews.Author: Vallerina30
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very informative and friendly. The room was available upon arrival and it was very clean. The location is in a great spot...within walking distance of Museum Campus as well as other attractions. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: karhov
Reviews.Content: It is a run down hotel. They need to completely renovate it. I was afraid to sit on the toilet cause it seemed it would break. everything in the room was old. This place is in need of some major upgrades. The restaurant is very bad too. Stay away from this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Iowa-Kathy-31722
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our son and his girlfriend stayed at Best Western Grant Park the weekend of November 5-7. Our son was auditioning for America's Got Talent, which was held at McCormick Convention Center. The BWGP was a great location for everything we did on the weekend. The staff was very nice, and made a great recommendation for a place nearby to eat, The Eleven City Diner. The room rate and parking rate were very reasonable. The only complaint - we had four to our room and not enough towels. But that was remedied after we requested more. Would highly recommend BWGP and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Melsat98
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Best Western Grant Park hotel in Chicago, Ilinois for a Bachelorette Party. I contacted their Sales Manager, Tara Chadwick, ahead of time to block off rooms for all of my guests and arrange a personal shower in their newly remodeled restaurant. I had a wonderful experience. The restaurant was clean and the staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Tara customized a package for our shower and the presentation of the food and drinks were amazing. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. They even called cabs for us when we were ready to leave for our dinner reservations. This was a busy weekend for the hotel as the Bears were in town and there was a city wide convention going on. Still the staff managed to take care of our group and give great service on all aspects of our stay! I would highly recommend using this location for any special event in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: SHAGUM
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice location to stay while in Chicago, you must stay at Best Wester Grand Park.... now, if you care about your sleep, the cleanlines and the staff.... go some where else. Several times, I woke up in the middle of the night due to the noise of the toilets at other rooms made. You can hear everything inside your rooms. The doors opening, the showers and the TVs of others. The AC was quite noisy too. Breakfast I purchased the American Breakfast plan and it was truly disapointing. Everyday the same eggs, the same hash brown. It was all the fat you can imagine. I loved the location, but I am not sure that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: brownsugarbabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 4 day business trip. When I got there the front desk staff was incredibly nice, very helpfull. Now the hotel..... First the air conditioner is quite loud and it wouldnt let me sleep all night, I had to turn it off the other nights so I could get some sleep. Internet would work sometimes only, not all the time, and for most times I had to call someone from maintenance, at the end I just gave up and never used it again. The location of the hotel is quite good. most things are just a $10 fare away. the hotel is also quite clean, but another thing that catched my attention most of the time is when I was leaving or entering the hotel, no one was there to get the door for you, most times you hade to do it by yourself, even if carrying packages and bags.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay on Lake Michigan!”
Reviews.Author: Galeda
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Grant Park Hotel is ideally located for seeing the sights in downtown Chicago. Located across from Grant Park at 11th Street, it's within walking distance of Soldier Field, the Museum Campus (with the Field Museum, Aquarium, and Planetarium), the Art Institute of Chicago, the Miracle Mile, Millenium Park with the new Cloud Gate, and, of course, Grant Park. The serivce we received was exemplary--everyone had our best interests in mind, from check-in to check-out. The staff is WONDERFULLY helpful and thoughtful, and even gave us a room upgrade (which we didn't have to ask for) upon check-in! The room (a mini-suite) had a lovely view of Michigan Avenue and the park, was nicely appointed and spacious, and had a refrigerator and microwave. Our only disappointment was that the beds were double beds (a little tight for two sleepers), and the mattresses very soft so that they sagged in the middle. The neighborhood is quite safe and very nice, with many restaurants within a few blocks. The best choice for breakfast is Yolk, which serves fabulous food just around the corner. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning on spending time at the Chicago lakefront; just be sure to ask for a room with queen beds, and as firm a mattress as possible. Then you'll have the perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: catsforkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct. 9 - I was running the Chicago Marathon the next day. The location is amazing - right next to Grant Park. The people at the desk were friendly and very helpful, The room was awesome...what a view of Grant Park, the museums, the lake and all the way to Navy Pier. The bed was very comfortable and the room very clean. We had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot. We received the extra pillows we requested. The only issue was city noise...I think the motorcyclists decided to ride around all night to keep the marathoners from sleeping...ear plugs are a good thing in the city. In contrary to what previous reviewers have said, there was absolutely NO EVIDENCE of bed bugs in the room and we searched too. The front desk said they had no reports of them and the BedBug Registry did not list the hotel but we checked the room thoroughly anyway. This is how congenial they are...when I called for a wake up call, they asked if I was a runner and they gave the runners a personalized wake up call with "good luck". I thought that was very nice and not something I would ever expect from the "bigger and better" and more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: wmcconnell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grant Park Best Western Hotel for 2 nights. Absolutely fantastic location, so extremely close to everything and all within walking distance. Felt so completely safe. Could not get over the cleanliness of the area. Hotel was old, but clean, a bit noisy at night (trains) Good value for the price. Beds were very comfy....they need to buy new pillows, very thin and lumpy......but would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Experience and Service”
Reviews.Author: CampbellsvilleCIE
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Grant Park was the perfect place for our group to stay. The location was ideal, within walking distance to Museum Campus, the train station, and many restaurants. The staff was helpful throughout the entire trip--planning, arrival, stay, and departure. I would reccomend the Best Western Grant Park to anyone traveling to Chicago that wants to have top-rate service, at a great location and for a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accomodations, great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkinSTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and found it adequate for my needs. Bed was very comfortable, though the pillows were very thin. Bathroom was clean, and non-smoking room did NOT have smokey smell. Front desk personnel could be friendlier, and the housekeeping staff needs to stop knocking on doors at 8am to clean the rooms. After first day, made sure to place the "do not disturb" sign on outside doorknob. Big plus for me was that the hotel was right across the street from the Metra station I needed to use to go to Hyde Park and the University of Chicago. There is a Subway, Starbucks, Caribou Coffee, and Jewel grocery store all withing walking distance. Would have liked to have a mini fridge in the room. Would stay again for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: boodleman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Grant Park for two weekends and one full week during the month of August and although not a great hotel by any means, it was more than adequate as a launch point to see the city. The location is by far the best selling point with the Roosevelt CTA station about 2 blocks away and the Metra "Museum" station in the park less than 1 block away and the Grant Park museum complex a mere 3-4 blocks. The restaurant downstairs was also a plus. The duck wraps and a cold draft beer come in at under $10 and were a welcome treat after a long day of hoofing around town. There's also a Whole Foods within walking distance West down Roosevelt St. with one of the best views of the city skyline to enjoy along the way. Also, Chinatown is only one stop away South on the CTA with it's great bakerys and restaurants. Lastly, it's only a 4 block walk over to Blue's great Buddy Guy's nighclub where a nightly live music fix is to be had for a resonable $10 during the week ($20 weekends)! On the minus side, there were some bumps like a missing TV remote on one visit and no towels on another trip but these were minor compared to the great location. I found the staff friendly and extremely helpful with directions, maps, and suggestions. All in all a good choice if you're on a budget and like to hit the sites! Not a great choice if you're prone to stay in the hotel for more than sleeping and relaxing, but who visits Chicago to stay in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tmr7
Reviews.Content: I booked our first trip to Chicago (from Ottawa, ON) in July using points. Since we didn't have quite enough points to stay further up Michigan we had to settle for the Best Western. At the time of booking we didn't even know which side of the river was more preferable. I continued to read review posts about this hotel and was getting quite discouraged that maybe we had made a mistake. However, upon our very early arrival our room was not ready but we sacrificed a king bed for a queen bed and a view to be envied of the park. We thoroughly enjoyed being entertained by the street views every evening and how relaxing it was to view the lake every morning. Thanks Alex at the front desk (who we never saw again...maybe he went on vacation!) As for other aspects of the hotel, it is very basic but very clean. We got Lavazza coffee, muffins and a yogourt parfait from the restaurant downstairs (Mei's Kitchen) on two days of our stay as the room provisions were not worth the effort to make. One night after 10 hours of touring and shopping all day, we had $3 beers at the downstairs restaurant before going our for dinner - great bargain for good beer (not swill water)! But we never ate a meal there. We could see part of the pool from our room but never had a chance to use it. As for the room itself, yes the pillow was lumpy as other reviewers wrote and the walls were thin but we compromised on price for location and found coping strategies. I must say we were pleasantly relieved with our accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE "WORST" WESTERN!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kailynsma
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Best Western Grant Park Hotel because of its proximity to a concert we were attending. The rooms were clean enough. The pool was disgusting. The worst part however, was the service. After the concert, we returned to our room at 1:30am. At 4:45 am the smoke detector battery was dying and the detector was chirping. We called the front desk and were notified that there was nothing she could do until someone else got there at 7am! We were also told to try and dismantle the smoke detector ourselves. Now, none of us had screwdrivers or anything with us, and isn't that a safety/fire hazard????? We had to listen to the loud chirping until 7am when the maintenance staff came up. We paid over $235 for a room we couldn't even sleep in! To make matters worse, we asked for a manager at check out (at 11am) and were told that no one would be in until 2pm! I called the corporate office and was told that they would have someone get back to me. 8 days later, no one has called me back. Corporate said all they could do is suggest to the hotel to contact me. Unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Very”
Reviews.Author: Samtoh
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was within our budget [$125 a night after tax]. It was our first time to Chicago. We stayed here 4 nights in a non-smoking double double room [no upgrade to a suite as one reviewer mentioned]. Next time, we will pay more for a better hotel. The overall experience was terrible to poor. We gave the hotel 2 stars only because of its location. We checked in around 11am. We were told our room was not ready because the hotel was full. That was not a problem for us. What annoyed us was when my husband handed over his passport for identification, the receptionist took a look at his visa to the US. What was she looking for? We felt this was uncalled for since the visa contains a lot of personal information. When we came back at 3pm to ask for our room keys, the same receptionist looked at us and then whispered something to another receptionist. What was she whispering about? The room is very basic. The bed is the biggest problem: the mattress is very lumpy and it does not provide support for your back. The pillow, as others have noted, is very thin. The wardrobe is without doors, the coffee maker is very old and the bathroom amenities are poor. The wall is paper thin. We could hear the conversation from the room next door and from the corridor. Housekeeping was a real issue. The housekeepers never once managed to replace all the things we used the 4 nights we stayed there. There were always fewer shampoos, cups and towels than what we began with. The final day was the worst. None of the towels we used were replaced. The day we checked out, the housekeepers knocked on the door at 8am! She wanted to know if we had checked out! The housekeeper was so eager to clean the room on the day we checked out but not while we were staying there. Next time we are in Chicago we'll stay in another hotel. This is one of the worst hotels we've stayed in. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kaaay
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel primarily because of the deal we received. We were a little nervous after reading some of the not so good reviews but needed to stay on budget while vacationing in Chicago. Room was very clean, requested a non smoking 2 double bed room and received a mini suite with 2 double beds, pull out couch, microwave, & fridge at no extra cost! Beds were super comfy, couch was fine for a teen. Unlike some of the reviews I read, elevator wait time was minimal (and we were on the 9th floor), had clean washcloths and towels every day, fairly quiet after 10 pm or so (and our stay was Wed. thru Sat. nights). Walk to mag. mile was a little far so took a bus to Navy Pier, staff was very helpful getting us to the right bus stop and back. Never felt unsafe (as a mom with teen son and daughter). Would stay here again with no hesitation. Only negatives were room not quite ready at check in time (was ready by 3:20) and pillows definitely need an upgrade...very uncomfortable. Sure, decor is dated but that didn't affect sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Take a Pass...”
Reviews.Author: nyfriend
Reviews.Content: Not clean, understaffed and awful service. Room smelled terrible, had to change. No doorman or anybody to help you with a bag. Valet parking a joke, nobody around, must find someone to park the car for $24 a day. Return to hotel after midnight, told to park on street and get car at 6:am because no valet on duty. Good location to musuems but spend the extra money someplace else and enjoy your travel. This place is a cash cow for owners, take out revenue, put nothing in.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chefermom2
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Best Western Grant park for 4 nights. I was in town for my companies national conference. The company has other more expensive hotels for us to stay at (Chicago Hilton/ Sheraton/Hyatt regency) but still out of my price range. I chose the BW due to price and Proximity to the Hilton (where I could catch free shuttles to McCormick place). I was a bit leery after reading a few reviews but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were basic but nice. The beds were comphy and clean. Bathroom was clean and towels were just fine. One day we had no washcloths so I left a note for our housekeeper and had some that night. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again.!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diesel021
Reviews.Content: We booked for three days. Yeah, like everyone else happy with the price we got. You thought Best Western that should be a nice place to stay. WRONG.!!!!. My first time in Chicago. And we get "greeted" has nothing to do with hotel. A very nice looking beggar hustled us out of money.Just to sit there and watch him give the same story to other people too.I'm thinking wow. The hotel does nothing about this. He did it to two other family's. We experienced about the same as some other reviews. No extra pillows,had to call for washcloths every night.The air conditions is awful.And the internet was sad. And the outlets are Old.Scary to plug your stuff into. NO we will never stay here again.We were happy to go to the Hyatt on the last night there in Chicago.I wish I would of read these reviews before booking. They need to read these reviews and fix their hotel.!!.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: StLer
Reviews.Content: When we got to our hotel, the room was not ready, and there were no baggage carts. I waited in the lobby until our room was ready (which is no easy feat with two young children). The room itself was fine; however, we noticed upon returning to the hotel to bathe our kids that night that there were no washcloths in the bathroom, only two towels, and two hand towels. Luckily the brought up towels and washcloths. When we went to bed, I discovered that there were no extra pillows in the room, and the pillows can best be described as huge clumps of cotton shoved into a pillowcase. The pillows were beyond flat. Not a huge deal - I called downstairs and asked for more pillows and was told they had run out of pillows!!!!!!!!! My quality of sleep was very poor because of this. Also, you could hear everything in the hallway - the walls are very thin. When people came back to the hotel at 3 a.m. being loud in the hallway, both I and my children were awakened. Several of the lamps did not work, and one of the outlets did not work. The location is great, but we paid $200 a night for this hotel, and expected much better quality than we received.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: vana1
Reviews.Content: While the hotel has a great location. It was quite dingy. Pillows were 1.5 inches thick and room was less than clean. Ceiling was peeling and bed coverings were very dated. Check in was less than pleasant, considering we were paying full rate. Parking was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbfuller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Grant Park Hotel because they gave a special rate for parents of the college students in the South Loop of Chicago. We were expecting a very basic hotel and that's pretty much what we have. The room is clean, the beds are comfortable and best of all the hotel is next door to the college. The museum campus and all Chicago attractions are close by, as are bus stops and the El stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't give them your credit card”
Reviews.Author: ToddLake
Reviews.Content: This hotel double booked us and it took us an entire day with a conference call to resolve the charges. We got shuttled back and forth with several uninformed and unconcerned employees--it took a call from our bank to the hotel to get our money back. The employees are not very bright and spend a lot of time socializing among themselves rather than attending to their responsibilities. The rooms on the north and east side have a great view and the location is across the street from Millenium Park and around the corner from the train. The shower and toilet were cracked, no ventilation fan, no small towels unless you ask for them. The room was not clean--found other people's used tissue. We had nothing but trouble from the start--should have known when we made simple reservations for two rooms and they couldn't get it together.

Reviews.Title: “A nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuffyRocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before commencing our Route 66 adventure. It was close to the start of the beginning of the route and convenient for other attractions nearby. The hotel was welcoming and the room was comfortable and clean. It was room only, there was no breakfast on offer. The only parking available was valet parking which on the downside was expensive but there was no other alternative. My understanding was that all parking was very expensive in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lumpiest pillow ever!”
Reviews.Author: coolrays
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is in a good location for seeing alot of great Chicago attractions but the pillows were like sleeping on a lumpy sandbag! Pretty bare bones room--2 beds, a TV and a desk. Tiny coffee pot in the bathroom. Phone in room only worked part-time. Computers in lobby out of order but they did have a kiosh-type computer for printing boarding passes. Borderline cleanliness, hotel looks very "tired". Ok for shower/sleep and out. Yolk resturant around the corner is fab for breakfast! Good deli 2 blocks away called 11, try the red velvet cake--to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Scooby_TS
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel and it's an incredible value for your money. The location is excellent. You are a step away from grant park, 5 - 10 minute walk from the shedd aquarium and planitarium. 15 minute walk from the "bean" and millenium park. Check in was smooth. Parking was 24 dollars a night. The rooms were actually decent with comfortable beds but they lacked pillows and toiletries so you must request more. The only downfall to this place is the lack of sound proofing as at night you can hear your neighbores, people in the hall and on the street. If you don't care about your room that much, stay here and save money to spend on sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keepthejalousiesopen
Reviews.Content: My husband and two young kids drove to Chicago from Toronto to visit the Shedd Aquarium. I chose this hotel because it was a 5 minute walk from the Shedd as well as across from Grant Park...it also got pretty good reviews on TripAdvisor.com. Once the reservation was made, I felt nervous and hoped it would be a good choice. Well, it turned out to be great! The room was very comfortable and had a nice view out the window (we were on the 8th floor). The key word is CLEAN. I did a bed bug inspection before we settled in and the mattresses and sheets and headboard were clean. Everything worked in the room from the A/C to the TV to the shower and water pressure. For dinner, we strolled around the corner to Eleven Diner which was a fun, cool restaurant...would recommend this diner! Next morning, we had breakfast at Yolk which was right next door on MIchigan Ave. Good food and coffee. Spend the day at the Shedd Aquarium and walking around the gorgeous parks of Chicago. For dinner, we ate at Mei's Place which is the lobby restaurant of the hotel. Food and service was great! In fact, we had breakfast there the next morning as well. The valet parking at the hotel worked out just fine for us. Check-out was smooth and the price was right! We were thrilled for the value this hotel offered us and we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: wolfrugger52
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, plenty of space and the staff was very helpful with all of my plans for our large group.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Rooms and Exceptinal service”
Reviews.Author: kayareus1
Reviews.Content: Was not sure what to expect from other rev iews, but overall this hotel is very convenient, clean and the staff is beyond accommodating. It's an older building and has a few flaws but consider the age it well maintained and I would definatley stay here time and time again. Parking is pricey but I found out it's pricey everywhere in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western at Grant Park is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MissyMom74014
Reviews.Content: awesome place to stay in Chicago because it's in walking distance to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: trinity916ki
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Friendly staff. Great location. Scary elevators.

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER!!!! BED BUGS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CandicelNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I was pleased that I was coming into Chicago to visit family that I've haven't seen in a long time. So my Aunt had booked us reservations at this hotel since it's a downtown location. Boy were we wrong! Here are the issues that we experienced during our stay and after you read my findings I hope that you take your buisness elsewhere so you can actually enjoy your time. On our 2nd morning my aunt discovered bites all over her body. As we looked through the bed we found 2 bedbugs between the mattress where my aunt was sleeping. We kept these bugs and pictures/videos that we will place on Youtube and we will be contacting our lawyer. This is disgusting on so many levels. How can they rent a room without conducting a inspection of these bugs???? So we had to check out right away. We didnt even bother going to the desk and complain. Why should we? To get a free night or our room being comp? It's not worth it and this Hotel never will have us, my family or friends as their guest. This experienced will be shared through everyone I know and everyone they know. I also did some research on-line a found similar complaints of this hotel having bed bugs in the past. I wished we did that before planning our family trip. But from this day forward we will. The Internet was a total JOKE. Yeah It's free but maybe because it never works as i heard and talked to other guest that had the same issues. They claim to blame that there are several guests using the wi-fi at the sametime. What a crock! Rooms were Cold and the Heater didnt work as good as they should had. We tried callinig down to the desk but the phone just kept ringing and ringing. 24 hours guest service as they claim didnt seem that way. Lobby was dirty and dusty. Elevator had a bad odor. Lobby furniture looked dirty and old. Lobby restrooms were dirty and not cleaned. The restaurant was COLD. Staff was okay. The Owners and Managers of this Hotel should be ashamed of it's product and the condition of the property. Please dont send me any letters or emails apologizing cause it wont matter to my family at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest Rate Guarantee Is a Fraudulent Advertising”
Reviews.Author: altecNy
Reviews.Content: I currently found a lower rate through expedia for a the same rate room through bestwestern but they refused to match the price. The customer service has not been helpful. It's very unfortunate they've lost a customer for life, for a simple price match.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: cmoon457
Reviews.Content: hotel was dirty! used condoms next to night stand, broken sink stopper in sink, and in bathtub. $25 to park and you can not get your car until you check out. valet driver pulled my car out of the parking garage like a mad man. i will not stay at this hotel ever again! this is the first time in years that i did not stay at a hampton inn so i guess im use to every thing working and being clean with free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: AivinM
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Chicago and it will not be the last, and I will stay at this Best Western again. The employees at the front desk are great! They are very polite and helpful. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable. This hotel is very clean, and that made me very happy! Love the coffee and bakery shop near the lobby. The location of the hotel can't get any better. Because of that we saved a lot of money in transportation. We walked everywhere! There are two breakfast places near by, Yolk right next door. The breakfast there is excellent and the portions are huge and the other one we loved was on the street right behind the hotel, Eleven City Deli. A Jewish deli with lost of personality, great food, huge portions and great service. I'm already planning my next trip to the windy city!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: aybsfan
Reviews.Content: Great location for the South Shore Line and the Shedd Aquarium. Our room was emmaculate as was the lobby. The bed was very comfortable...wish I could have brought it home with me. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: ejh4933
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the best location for the price, right on Michigan Ave. and walking distace to a lot of attractions. however the walls are thin and you can here the train going by every now and then plus the people in the hall. While the staff is nice there aren't enough. I you want your car call for AT LEAST thirty min. before you need it, it takes awhile. I only stayed two nights and didn't spend much time in the room so it was ok, I liked the location for sight seeing, and YOLK the breakfast place next door, I would probably stay again just because of the value. Also the computers in the lobby can be used to print things out but many people had difficulty with it, but if you call the help hotline on the computer they are GREAT and will get what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for location but experienced irritating problems.”
Reviews.Author: Capelle
