Reviews.Content: The hotel has a Michigan Avenue address, but its main axis runs east-west along 11th St. This means only two rooms per floor, at the eastern end, face Grant Park and the lake, the rest face either north or south, looking out at tall buildings. All rooms are of the same size, or very close to it, and they are of modest size, especially by American standards. Ours had a standard (and comfortable) double bed, which left enough space for reasonable comfort, but nothing more. We took a lake-facing room. We paid a substantial premium for this, but the outlook was very nice, indeed. However, we were on the 9th/top floor, and I would think at anything on the 6th or below, the more limited outlook would not justify the cost. Further, these rooms face Michigan Avenue, which is a very busy city street - on the 9th floor, traffic noise was quite intrusive; below that, it would be progressively worse. There is a valet parking service, for which the daily charge is $24 (plus tax). I thought this was quite a hit, but it turned out to be reasonable in comparison with other nearby sites, of which there are many; in fact, I didn't find one cheaper. The parking used is adjacent to the hotel, just metres away, but there is no self-parking and the hotel will not allow you to access your car while it's parked there. If you want to do so, they have to bring the car to the door. The hotel's location, directly opposite Grant Park and about a mile south of downtown, is really good, certainly at this price. The #3 bus runs past the door, and it will take you north to the Magnificent Mile in about 5 minutes. We were very pleased with the location. But we had several irritating problems. When we arrived, the room had no lighting at all except for two low-powered bedside lamps - it soon got too dark! We asked for a floor lamp and that was duly delivered, with the comment that it should have already been there - did no-one notice this? Next, because of the number and location of electrical outlets, we found the microwave would not work unless the fridge was unplugged, and vice versa. We complained about this, and a man duly arrived with sundry electric cables and, eventually, got everything to work. Again, sloppy. Finally, there was the wifi, or lack of it. Wifi is supposed to be available in all rooms, but would not work in our room (although, when I tried my laptop in the lobby, that worked fine). We stayed for 3 days and, still, when we left - no room wifi. Annoyingly, the reception staff always tried to deflect this issue to their service provider (their first proposal was that I, a guest, should contact this provider) without, I believe, making the slightest effort to fix the problem. On checkout, they conceded "there might be a problem on the 9th floor", still attributing it to their ISP. I doubt this situation will ever change so, if wifi room connection is important to you, I recommend you test the room offered before committing to it. We enjoyed the location, the room was comfortable, and the rate for this location was not bad. But........irritating problems!

Reviews.Title: “Useful base for discovering Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RichoSunderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days at the beginning of August. It's nothing spectacular but it served as a good, comfortable base whilst we were in Chicago. The hotel is very convenient for attractions in the Loop and those of the Museum Campus. Also easy access to the lakeside where there are spectacular views of the Chicago skyline. We ate breakfast in the restauarant one morning and there was nothing wrong with the build-your-own omelette but there are other options in Yolk next door. The Eleven City Diner round the corner on S Wabash is pretty much open all hours and is handy if you've had a hard days sightseeing. Another local option is The Exchequer pub and restaurant a little further North on S Wabash - really good food. There is also a Jewel-Osco for groceries further South on S Wabash although for some reason the area around it suddenly becomes a bit more edgy. The Lollapalooza festival was on in Grant Park when we were there which was interesting although it obviously meant access to the Park was restricted. The Art Institute of Chicago is 10 minutes walk away as is the Crown fountain and the Cloud Gate (aka 'The Bean') and definitely make sure you take a ride on the actual 'Loop' itself.

Reviews.Title: “Tops in service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Deb052
Reviews.Content: The staff were always very helpful, knowledgeable, and responsive. Great location. Our room was comfortable, but very tight on space. We didn't have a full supply of towels, but the staff was quick to respond when I called about this. The help at the front desk was always very accommodating, informative, and polite. I was surprised that we didn't experience nighttime noise from other guests. We didn't try the restaurant. The location is excellent. Parking costs $24 a night, and we could not access our car without valet service, but this was acceptable, given the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Room for What You Get”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while visiting Columbia College for orientation. We paid $179 per night, which I think is high for this quality of a hotel. Supposedly there was a conference going on and they could not give us the "Columbia College" discount. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly during our stay. Our room was on the 8th floor with a nice view of Grant Park and a slight view of the lake if you looked hard enough. While it was nice to have a view, you also get the Michigan Avenue street noise on this side of the hotel. The room was adequate, and the beds were pretty comfortable. We selected this hotel due to its proximity to Columbia College, free wireless internet and $24 per night valet parking, which is much less than other hotels. However the front desk clerk asked if we would be using our car during the stay, and when we told him no he directed us to a secure parking garage a couple blocks away which charges $14 per night. We ate at Mei's Restaurant in the hotel for one meal, and it was just okay. I probably won't go back there. But as others have suggested, Yolk next door serves up an awesome breakfast. I would stay at this hotel again if I was able to get a better rate. Otherwise I think there are nicer hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel with few frills.”
Reviews.Author: Martian181
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable with minimum frills. It was in a good location, right next to Grant Park and close to their public transportation system. Unfortunately for us, the Chicago Bears stadium happens to be right across Grant Park and we happened to be staying there a weekend when the Bears were playing at home; for about 2 hours after the game let out, COMPLETE chaos outside our hotel room as people frantically tried to grab taxis. Other than that, it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the lake”
Reviews.Author: snappdogg15
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Chicago. Very friendly staff. 2 blocks from a subway stop. Very convenient. 3rd story pool. Next door to an excellent breakfast place. Right across from the park. Upgrade to the lakeview rooms. It is worth it. No complaints here. The outside is not anything special but will more than suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: SDMCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed because it was relatively close to the convention center. He found the rooms small but clean and adequate. Staff were helpful. And to save money it was only a block from the train to get to and from the airport (a couple of dollars compared to cab fare). Not a lot of choice or restaurants in the area but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ParentsOf3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for St. Patrick's Day weekend (03/13-03/15/09). Clean, comfortable, easy access to parking. A bit of a hike to downtown area, but window shopping along the way was pleasant. Would be very convenient to Soldier Field.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, hard to regulate temperature”
Reviews.Author: oc3anz
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the BW Grant Park Hotel in Chicago is it's location. A 5-minute walk from Museum Campus (Aquarium, Planetarium, Field Museum), with bus stops right outside to take you up to the Art Institute or Magnificent Mile, and a great view if you get an east-facing room. The second best thing about this hotel was actually the restaurant that is attached to its lobby, "Mei's Kitchen". For breakfast only, it provides an excellent value - it's "Eggsellent Dish" consists of 2 (LARGE) eggs, meat, toast/bagel, with hash brown or a large bowl of fruit for under $7.00 US. The fruit is actually sweet and fresh, not canned or frozen - even in February! The service and the rooms were ok - not sparkling or sophisticated but decent enough, and a great value in the off-season. The worst part was the temerature - we had a north-facing view and it was hard to regulate so it was either too hot or too cold! The fitness centre is a tiny room with a couple of cardio machines, and the pool is outside - so forget about it in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, only OK location.”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_in_20s
Reviews.Content: Chicago was the starting point for our 3 week trip in the States. We originally booked this hotel online coming up to the time we were due to go away. Starting to panic, we just looked for a nice, recognizable name somewhere that looked accessible. We were pleasantly surprised. We aimed for something cheap and cheerful and that is what we got. The hotel was nice, it was clean and comfortable whilst not being too over the top. Rooms were nice, again clean and comfortable which is most important for me and spacious enough. It also has Internet access for guests in the lobby. The staff for the most part were nice but had maybe one or two members who could have been more helpful or even just friendly! The hotel had a restaurant which again was nice but again nothing too fussy, if that is what you're looking for. The biggest problem with the hotel I found was perhaps the location. Whilst it was perfect for sightseeing in the Grant Park / aquarium, planetarium and museum area, it was a little out of the way for the rest and for night life etc. We found ourselves most nights just ending up in the hotel restaurant because we were so tired from walking all day and hadn't the energy to walk a ways to find another decent restaurant, which was very disappointing. Overall, the hotel surprised us as we were starting to worry over its location. We received a lovely welcome and in general we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, for the price...”
Reviews.Author: niniche
Reviews.Content: I found a bargain deal on this hotel on Expedia (?) and from the reviews I had read on here (Tripadvisor) I wasnâ€™t expecting very much for my money. The free wireless and my own bathroom where the main reasons I had booked here. My room was large, as was the bathroom. On the ninth floor of the building. Yes, the furnishings were bland and dated, but that was okay with me. What really bugged me though was the noise; the constant noise. On the first night I just assumed that it was the wind and that I heard it more because I was on the top floor â€“ and thought nothing more of it. I am a light sleeper at the best of times and usually sleep wearing earplugs. I had to keep the earplugs in whenever I was in my room and not watching television. The noise drove me insane. I donâ€™t know what it was â€“ probably an old fashioned antiquated ventilation system. The noise really threatened to ruin my time there. On another note, the maid took off with one of my tshirts and some of my underwear â€“ and didnâ€™t return them. Would I stay here again? Perhapsâ€¦ but only for less than Â£50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Blame it on the Bears”
Reviews.Author: castorbean
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in past after Bears nite games as the location is convenient and the price is low. Never had a problem though would have rated it just "okay". The last time I spent the nite is the last time I will stay. A man was on the loose in the hall, yelling and banging aggressively on doors. I called the front desk and was told that I was the second complaint and that they needed one more complaint to take action as the hotel had a "three complaint" policy. Did not sleep all night which negated the reason for even being there. I live about an hour away and should have made the drive. I wrote two letters when I got home, one to corporate Best Western and one to the local facility. Got a call from the local customer service saying that I must have misunderstood the policy and the front desk did not say what I heard. Got an email from corporate reiterating the response I got from the local unit and offering a gift card for 25$ to be used.... at Best Western. There is a very nice Hyatt down the street as well as a myriad of other hotels. I will be spending the extra money to stay at one of them in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: jirrupin
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel through Priceline, and stayed here for four nights. It's a fairly basic hotel and the decor is old school, but it is very close to the Roosevelt station, and it's only a 15 minute walk to the heart of the Loop and Millenium Park. We also really liked the free internet in the room. Our room was on the 4th floor and had no real view to speak of. One annoying problem we encountered was on the first day there, we returned to our room at 5:15pm to find it still hadn't been cleaned. Apparently the cleaner just skipped it, but it was a little annoying. If you do stay here, be sure to have breakfast or brunch at Yolk which is basically next door. Their Chicken Fajita Omlette is not to be missed. All in all, the Best Western is a fine choice if you're watching your pennies in Chicago, but if you can afford better, then do it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: On_Holiday_154
Reviews.Content: We were five students who booked a room at the Grant Park. Overall, we had a good experience. Pluses: Clean, helpful staff, convenient location on the edge of the Loop, not far from the McCormick Convention Center and close to the El. Minuses: Make sure your suite really has a fold-out couch. Ours did not, and we weren't allowed a roll-a-bed (Chicago law?), so one of us bunked on the couch. The bathroom did not have a sink separate from the toilet/shower, which is a problem when you have five women in a room. Warning: The restaurant next door makes hideously awful cocktails so be forewarned! The price was excellent because we booked well in advance, so overall, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice view!”
Reviews.Author: happimags
Reviews.Content: We were quite high up so the view out of the window was good Liked Chicago very much loved millenium park. Parking in the surrounding area was poor. Understand the coach driver had to move the coach in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Price”
Reviews.Author: NZAndos
Reviews.Content: We were looking for accommodation in down town Chicago that was clean but was in our price range. This hotel surpassed our expectations, actually working out less expensive than we were originally quoted. Whilst the decor may be some what dated, it provided the service required.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: michellel391
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Best Western Grant Park, and I have to admit we were pleasantly surprised. When we arrived, the hotel exterior looks exactly like the pictures on the web site -- not good -- but we picked this hotel for the location and the price. The front desk staff -- all I can say is they did their job. They were not rude because we didn't have any problems, but they were not extremely friendly and welcoming either. The valet were extremely friendly and helpful though, even when we didn't need our car. Our room was pretty small, but we had a king bed which was probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in; however, the pillows sucked. Our room was also "wheelchair accessible," but again, it was small. As for wheelchair accessible, I would only recommend this room for persons who can easily transfer themselves because the bathroom was kind of small too. We had a stand-in shower (no tub) with a fold-down bench, but the bench sat up pretty high. We didn't use the pool, but saw it. It was very small. No wheelchair access to the pool. Like I said, we chose this hotel for its location. It is walking distance to the Field Museum/Shedd Aquarium/Planetarium and Soldier Field, right across the street from a Metra stop, and around the corner from the Roosevelt "L" stop. There are several nice restaurants in the area as well. We also had lunch in the restaurant attached, which was OK. But we enjoyed having a few cocktails at the bar before heading to bed. I would recommend this hotel for its convenience and as a place to sleep. We didn't actually spend very much time in our room because we were always on the go. The hotel isn't as trashy as the pictures make it seem. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: iampranav
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via continental.com with the primary reason being 1. The cheapest on Michigan Avenue 2. Reasonable valet parking charges 3. Decent reviews online We were travelling with 1 yr. old and absolutely happy with the location, service etc. Rooms were little smaller but I guess that's ok. Walking distance to Sears Tower, Milleneum Park, B. Fountain. In worst case, doesn't cost more than 10 bucks for a cab from any attractions to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again... And best part, conviniently located from Roosvelt Train Station and other Metra Station.

Reviews.Title: “Lower priced option”
Reviews.Author: pashadarby
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about reserving this hotel, as the price was on the lower side of Chicago hotels. And the reviews I had read were mixed. We had a nice room on the 9th floor, with views of Lake Michigan. Walking distance (less than 2 blks) to Shedd Aquarium and Subway. Restaurant/bar on site...decent food/price. We were very pleased w/ our accommodations....

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Version of a Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Benzaiohio
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this "hotel" as the facilities at the conference I was attending were sold out - the Palmer House Hilton. Now, the Palmer House is a very nice, vintage hotel sitting right on top of the Red Line. Itâ€™s a pretty cool place to drop by if you like art deco motifs and a cool throwback lobby bar. However, I spent my nights at the Best Western Grant Park. Now I know that our friends at the ole' BW don't advertise that their properties will be on par with a Hilton, however they are expected to hold up some modicum of adequacy. This property is anything but... The exterior of the hotel is as tired and careworn as Phyllis Diller after a long night in Vegas. It literally looks like its about to be torn down. Shabby and tattered, it sticks out like a sore thumb amongst the gleaming new high rise condos along the lakeshore. The lobby is small and noisy, but does have two complementary computers for the use of guests. Check in was quick and easy, and then I made my way to the room. My room was a reflection of the exterior, beaten down and threadbare. It was dirty and the furniture was â€˜beaten upâ€™ â€“ literally. It looked like someone had been at it with a ball-peen hammer. The television was so old it required some odd device to enable it to have a remote control and the tuner inside hummed like someone on the Gong Show. I turned it off almost as soon as I turned it on. The bedâ€¦well, the bed had one of those wonderful scratchy polyester bedspread things that you wonder what would be on it if you blacklighted the room â€“ it went in the closet as soon as I walked in. It was as lumpy as cold oatmeal and the sheets stank of bleach. I suppose that I should have been happy they were sanitized. I will say one good thing, the two pillows they supplied were awesome â€“ the squishy huggable kind. The bathroom was crammed into the corner of the room and was also pretty filthy. I love flipping back the shower curtain to see a very long red hair draped over the tub. Yummy! The toiletries were standard BW wrapped soaps and mystery shampoos. There were no tissues in the dispenser and it was not refilled the three days I was trapped there. I did not venture into the pool, which looked like it belonged in a trailer park, but I did go to their â€œworkout roomâ€�. It was wedged into a converted guest room and did have a treadmill, stepper, elliptical and universal machine. There was a TV in there to watch while you sweated away. I went back to the room from the conference at 2:30 one afternoon and my room had still not been serviced (which I can understand as I was not checking out that day.) However, when I did politely ask the maid in Spanish if she could clean my room next she basically rolled her eyes and stormed back to her cart. I made sure to hide my toothbrush before she went to the room to clean it. The strange thing about this hotel for me was that I was the only U.S. citizen staying in it. I heard more languages spoken in those three days than I did when I toured the U.N. building. I know the dollar is weak enough for our European and Pacific Rim friends to stay in better locations. However, I saw more German backpackers and folks toting cameras that I ever have in one, filthy little place. Bottom line, if this hotel is actually still operating when you go to book your trip and has not been condemned, find another place to stay. There is an actual Hostel down the street on Wabash that looked a hell of a lot nicer and is probably cheaper. And, yes, it too will have the German backpackersâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Overall decent place”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: Service was generally good and efficient. Front desk overall efficient, e.g. a request for extra blankets was fulfilled within 10 minutes. Lobby is clean and fresh. Room was cleaned daily to a decent standard. Nice big TV in room with big windows and great views if you face the Lake direction. However can get draughty in the wind, and the heating is noisy: think Boeing 747 taking off for the sound effect! Location is extremely far from Mag Mile - further than Hilton Towers - but good for the Museum Campus/Bears Stadium. Adjacent restaurant offers an amazingly expensive breakfast at $30 per person. Beware! Better to head up S Michigan to get something elsewhere for $10! The coffee provided in the room is pretty disgusting. However overall a decent hotel and better than the run down exterior suggests. Recommened if the Hilton up the street is above your budget.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rbn326
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel located on S. Michigan Avenue in the Grant Park area of Chicago. We stayed in room 917, which appeared to be recently remodeled. I think it was the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was fresh and clean, no hair, soap scum or mildew in sight. I was very impressed with how clean and white everything was. The beds were very comfortable. The pillows were a little softer than I like, but were ok. Everything was clean and fresh - I wasn't even afraid to walk on the carpet with no shoes on. Some reviews I have seen complain about noise from the Loop, but I did not hear any noise. It's fairly close to the Loop, but not close enough to disturb your sleep. This hotel is about 2 miles from the Navy Pier and the front desk clerks are very helpful with tips on how to get around. We booked through Expedia and saved a lot on the room rate. The only problem we had was that the hotel parking garage is closed for renovation so we had to park in an open lot a couple of blocks away that was $13 a night. It would have been nice to know ahead of time that the parking garage would be unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dandm2006
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at a reasonable price. We found the Grant Park Best Western clean, quiet and very close to everything we wanted to do in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: jennann429
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Chicago for the first time to attend a seminar at the Art Institute, and was looking for a hotel within walking distance that wouldn't give my accounting department a heart attack. There were a couple others on Michigan Ave that I considered before going with the Best Western, and I'm glad I did! I arrived VERY early (10 am!) and the front desk was kind enough to verify that my room was indeed not ready, then offered to store my bags & recommended a cafe next door for brunch and a map of the area. (FYI Yolk is the cafe, not attached to the hotel but next door on Mich Ave... Best Breakfast Ever!) When I returned around 1:00 my room was ready, still 2 hours before the prescribed check-in time! Decor seemed relatively new (I vaguely remember reading about renovations in the past year), no peeling paper or dings in the furniture. Bed was very comfy with a thick pillowtop, and bath was very clean & nicely appointed. Management had also implement some "green" practices which is something I like to look for in a hotel! Linen re-use, low-flow toilets & water conserving showerheads were all great to see. Free internet access, although I couldn't get the wi-fi signal for some reason & used the provided LAN cable instead. I would recommend this hotel to budget-constricted business travelers and families who want to be within walking distance of many of Chicago's attractions! Museums & aquarium are very close, shopping & Navy Pier are a bit of a hike but good exercise in nice weather. The only drawback is the noise. It didn't keep me up at night, but did disturb a mid-afternoon nap... not the 'El' or traffic so much, but right next door is the music department of Columbia College, and they like to rehearse on the top floor with the windows open, so you can hear every note!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western, a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pumpman2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a Medical show at McCormick Place. It was a nice hotel better than expected. Quick Check-In in Clean room,. Had a coffeemaker and hairdryer in the room. The front desk was pleasant and knowledgeable. Had nice lobby with two internet computer, Free internet access (wireless) There was a connected restaurant that had above average food and drink. The hotel is almost directly on Michigan avenue within a brisk 15 minute walk of McCormick. I walked North on Michigan to Radio shack and Walgreen's so it is nicely located. I would recommend this hotel now and in the future. It is a quality establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms & location but pretty noisy.”
Reviews.Author: anon037
Reviews.Content: On balance this was a good hotel for the $88 + taxes I paid per night. Its only a short walk to the centre of Chicago and is close to the lake etc and the rooms were fine, definitely a cut above budget places I've stayed in for the same amount. The one (pretty big) drawback is the noise. I had a room on the 8th floor of the north side of the hotel (i.e. not directly onto Michigan Avenue, but it was still horrendously noisy. The windows are single glazed and so you can clearly hear all of the traffic as well as the elevated train, which runs close by. To further add to this noise, my room (824 I think) was also near the lifts and an ice-making machine (which must have been powered by a large tractor engine considering the noise). On the second night I moved rooms down the corridor away from the lifts and bought some earplugs, and then slept fine. I am a light sleeper and noise does wind me up when Iâ€™m trying to get to sleep so you can maybe ignore my opinion if you never have a problem (although previous reviewers have also commented on the noise). I would use this hotel again but wouldn't forget to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MoDeFo
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Chicago for a conference. The conference hotel was too expensive, so I was looking for a less expensive hotel that was near the conference site. I searched several websites and found the Best Western Grant Park. It fit my requirements! At first, I was very worried about my selection. The picture of the BW building made it look old and run down. The pictures of the room looked better than those of the building but the decor seemed somewhat spartan! Several reviews from this site suggested that the hotel was basic but very clean and that the staff was very friendly. I put my faith in the trip advisor reviewers and they didn't let me down! I was pleased with my selection. This hotel is not as sexy or enticing as some of the trendy boutique hotels, but it is well maintained! If you're looking for luxury- you should bypass this spot. But, if you want a nice and affordable place, this will definitely serve that purpose. The exterior is pretty basic. The room interior was fine- flowered comforters and curtains, beige wallpaper, teal carpet, a picture on the wall...it's fine! The beds were nice and comfy. The wireless access was free (this was greatly appreciated)! I think the beds were doubles instead of queens but we quickly got over this. Also, the room wasn't as large as I thought it would be based on the website pictures- but it was not cramped (3 adults had a little room to move around). My only gripe with the hotel is that our wash cloths were taken but not replaced (hand and bath towels were replaced)- I found that odd and slightly frustrating but easily remedied! There is a little restaurant and wine bar off of the lobby. I didn't have a chance to go there but it seemed as though they had some decent wines available! The hotel is not too far from Millennium Park and one of the art museums. The hotel is in walking distance to the Loop and subway stops. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Closest to Soldier Field”
Reviews.Author: BearsnCubs
Reviews.Content: After scoring tickets for my very first Chicago Bear game, I immediately started searching for a hotel. I read reviews on this hotel and moved on. This happened several times before I finally broke down and made the reservations. After driving for 3 hours we saw Soldier Field. At 1am Chicago time we were taking pictures outside to capture the moment. When we got into the car and started to our hotel we so excited. The hotel is only 2 1/2 blocks away. Check in was easy. We met other Bear fans, and a few Saints (boo) before we finally went to our room. When we peeked out the window... wow.. Soldier Field was right there. The hotel staff was very friendly.The rooms were very clean. Beds were comfortable. We had one thing go wrong and that's the shower head sprayed all over the bathroom, but we fixed it and let the front desk clerk know. There's a parking garage that is attached to to the Best Western that we chose because Valet was closed for the night. It was $20.00 to park but we didn't have to drive to the game we just left our car and walked. You can park in front of meters on the weekend and that's free. Even during games. But we chose to keep our car inside, off the streets. The next morning we went to the restaurant attached to the hotel totally expecting an outrageous pricing menu. Shocked were we when we found out 2 eggs, a bowl of fruit and toast was only $4.95. We were served within 5 minutes of ordering which helped since we were heading for the game. It was a win, win situation. I won by getting a great hotel at a great price, great location and the Bears won the most amazing game ever! Thanks for a great time Chicago! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “clean, no-frills downtown bargain (except for parking, that is)”
Reviews.Author: techconfgoer
Reviews.Content: Came here for an Adobe trade show. Booked my room late, and so couldn't find anything even at the Courtyard/Hampton Inn level for less than $200-250. I got the Best Western Grant for 3 nites in late September during this big trade show for just $150. The room was clean and I had a decent view of Lake Michigan. Gym was tiny but enough for me to get a decent workout and help me get to bed. Attached cafe was overpriced for what it served (I got casual breakfast stuff) but ok as I was on company per diem. Wi-fi was a little weak, but at least it was included. For a biz guy, the location was great - a few blocks away was a nice district with trendy, non-touristy restaurants. Towards the water was Grant Park and all of the art institutions and a great place for a morning walk. I didn't do that, though I did rent a bike at one of the two nearby bike shops and ride through the park south to the University of Chicago. I did take a nice stroll - about a mile - every morning to the show at McCormick Place, a huge hall which is plopped down south of downtown in a poor neighborhood. The Best Western may be one of the closest biz hotels nearby. Anyway, the walk is very safe during the day, and ok at night if you follow the right major roads (there are a ton of new upscale condos just a few blocks away). Shopping and some of the family stuff on the piers is far away, that's true.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't care about decor, this is the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller747
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Grant Park is located a twenty-minute walk north to the magnificent mile and a ten minute walk south to the Museum complex with the Red Line â€˜ELâ€™ a 5 minute walk west. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the area and will always greet you with a smile. The hotel itself is tired and the decor dated but itâ€™s very clean and well managed. Rooms are spacious with good facilities including Wifi. All in all, if you don't care what the room looks like when you are asleep, and you have more sense than money, this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: VinoDuo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. From check-in (which was botched) through check-out, we had a terrible experience. 1) The sound of the El train is so loud it sounds like the next stop is in the room. 2) The bed was like a marshmallow. Our backs were in spasm each morning. 3) The exercise room is on a timer and doesn't let you in with your key-card until 7 am. I had a 7.30 meeting and needed to work out the kinks from the bed at 6;30. Couldn't get in the work-out room. 4) The first room I check into had no toilet paper. 5) The second room I checked into had a fan running in the bathroom that could not be turned off. My client's TA booked us here...whatever you do, don't be fooled into staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but in the competition”
Reviews.Author: prophotoguy
Reviews.Content: If you like noise and no privacy, the Grant Park Hotel is for you. Be sure to ask for the "Lake View" room, which guarantees the soothing roar of Michigan Avenue beneath your bed all night. Forgot to set your alarm? Don't worry, you'll hear the one in the next room just fine. Room too warm? The air conditioner does double duty by loudly drowning out the buses and honking outside your window, and you'll think it's January with an open window as an icy breeze blow dries your hair as you sleep. If you want to remember your breakfast all day with stomach cramps and an urgency to be near a toilet, don't miss a meal in the adjoining restaurant. If you haven't had time to finish the novel you brought on your trip, you'll easily get through a chapter or two before your order is taken, and you'll be well into your next book before your food arrives.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room,great location,good service”
Reviews.Author: Maja66
Reviews.Content: Me and husband stayed this August in Best Western Grant Park for 9 nights.Staff on front desk were friendly and ready to help if needed.Our room on 6th floor was very comfortable, with very large double bed, safe box in room (usual in other hotels in USA you need to pay extra for renting safe box),nice bathroom,and we had nice view on Museum campus.We had no problem with noise ,niether from other guests or noise from outside.Location of hotel is the best, Chicago EL train station for red,green and orange lines is only block from hotel and from there you can go everywhere you want.If you are staying in Chicago more days buy 3 or 7 days pass (12 - 20$)valid for unlimited rides on EL trains and CTA buses.Across from EL train station is big grocery store Jewel Osco opened 24 hours where you can buy pass . In front of hotel is CTA bus station ,take number 3 or 4 to go up to beautiful Millenium Park and Magnificent Miles.Hotel is really excellent located ,on peaceful area a little bit away from downtown bustle but with public transportation all attractions are easy accessible.Our experience in this hotel was very pleasant considering that this is 2*hotel and affordable with price it is very decent hotel and we would reccomend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick”
Reviews.Author: Otago
Reviews.Content: A little bit pricey (I assume this reflects the location), but comfortable. Greeted with a smile even at the early hours of the morning at which we arrived. The little diner/cafe downstairs fit the bill for breakfast the next day. All in all a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: lindacul
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through Quikbook for our stay for the Lollapalooza music festival. I booked it about 2 months before the event, and decided on this hotel due to price and location (right across the street from Grant Park where the festival was)and lack of availability at comparable hotels. I booked it for $159 a night, which upon booking, seemed high for this place. I had stayed there about 10+ years ago and it wasn't much to write home about. Since my last stay the hotel has had an interior facelift. The rooms were nicely appointed, newer furnishings, pretty clean and comfortable. We stayed in a king room on the 9th floor. Check-in was great--our room was ready early. Front desk staff was great (thanks Nakita!). Since the majority of our ttme was spent at the festival, i did not see much of the hotel facilities (pool, etc). They do have a nice coffee/wine cafe downstairs with an outdoor seating area. The only down side to staying here was the location. There are not alot of restaurants/bars. etc in the immediate area. If you need to be in the south loop/grant park area this hotel would be fine. Otherwise you will need to take a cab, the L (there is a stop 2 blocks away) , or bus everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “clean, affordable, basic needs.”
Reviews.Author: permatri
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel, while exploring Chicago for the first time. Location was perfect, in walking distance to all major atractions and with plenty of restaurants nearby ( + one in hotel). Our double/double room was clean, internetservice worked perfectly and staff was friendly and helpfull. We where a little nervous after reading about waiting times on check in and out, but it worked fine for us. We did see however that some people had a long waiting time getting their room and there was some angry guests in the lobby. The breakfast buffet is much to expensive ( 15$ ), choose coffee and a croissant if you arenÂ´t that hungry or go to one of the many nearby restaurants for a much cheaper option. All in all this hotel worked perfect for us and is suitable for anyone who needs a clean, affordable place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “it was a good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: verhbar_7
Reviews.Content: We went to chicago for a couple of days and stayed in this hotel.. For the money 145.00 a night it was not bad.. We were walking distants for the musumes. There is a free trolly that picks you up not to far from the hotel either.. We tried the taste of chicago that was ok, but alot of people.. over all the room was ok for the money. the bed was kind of hard, but I would stay there again in the furture..

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: trcarey
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on short notice, and selected it only because of the rate. I wasn't expecting much, but figured it would at least be clean and serve its purpose. From the very beginning, I had trouble. There were two people working the check-in desk. I was fortunate enough to have the decent clerk. The other woman checking people in was rude to all customers and acted extremely put out that she had to help people. Once I got to my room, it appeared to be right on target with what I expected, a standard room with one queen bed. Just to be sure, I decided to check the bed for any stains or questionables. I was horrified when I lifted the sheet. The mattress pad was completely covered in pubic hairs. The bedspread also had questionable stains all over it. The housekeeping service was very apologetic and got new linens for the bed. (They were the few employees that seemed to care about how guests felt.) The walls are paper thin. You can hear everything anyone in the hall or next room is saying. The doors to the rooms can only be shut by pulling very hard on them. So any time someone comes or goes from a room, you can hear the doors slamming which is just about constant in a hotel. The trash service to the alley below comes early on Sunday mornings. Expect to be awoken to several dumpsters being picked up and dropped for about 30 minutes. Contacting the front desk is also difficult. I had to make several phone calls down until someone picked up. When I finally got through, the clerk was extremely rude and didn't want to answer a simple question about how to check out. She finally just hung up on me without answering my question as to whether or not I could just leave the keys in my room as I had prepaid. As I mentioned, I was not expecting much with this hotel. You would expect though from a hotel chain, that they could at least provide clean beds and friendly service. I would strongly encourage anyone considering this hotel to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: lindalouhue
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago and took the Orange El train to Roosevelt. We walked only 2 blocks to our hotel. Our check-in went smooth and fairly quickly. We had prepaid through Expedia and had no problem checking in. We were on the 7th floor facing the North. It was close to the El trains. At times we did hear them, but they were not as bad as some viewers said. If we had been facing them directly then I could see where it might have been a problem. The rooms were of average size and Clean. The staff always greeted us as we were coming and going. The pool was not yet open but we were never at the hotel long enough to use it anyway. We picked this hotel because it was close to the Museums. We walked to the Museum campus and took The CTA buses and trains everywhere else. We had no problems with transportation and my son loved using our visitor passes whenever we went anywhere. Chicago is a huge city and we saw alot of it. This was my second trip to Chicago and I will definitly be back. And by the way, our Check-out went just as smoothly as our Check-in. Thanks to Chicago for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: takeahike2
Reviews.Content: Great location, but noisy inside and out since the train runs over the street one block away. The beds and linens need updating. If you want anything more than basic, try getting a special on a hotel downtown near Michigan Ave (magnificent mile). Sights like Millennium Park and the Art Institute are walkable from either location. Note: This area is made for walking, taxis are everywhere, shuttles go to/from the airports, and the train is easy to use, so skip the car!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay for the price...”
Reviews.Author: tsw729
Reviews.Content: This is a small nine story hotel located directly across from Grant Park on Michigan Avenue. You will be 1/4 mile (5 minute walk) from the Roosevelt Subway Stop (Orange, Red, and Green Lines)... From there you can get to many different areas of the city. Train Ride to the Downtown Loop is only 10 minutes max. Upon arrival our check-in was pretty standard... Usual check of our credit card and reservation. They actually asked for my AAA card.. (No one hardly does!) Anyways... Upon entering our room, the wife immediately complained of a urine smell coming from the bathroom. I was hoping maybe someone just didn't flush the toilet, but upon inspection, it appears that it was coming from the base of the toilet... We just threw a towel on the floor and shut the door... Fixed the problem without having to go through the trouble of asking for another room. The room walls are thin as you can hear your neighbors shower, alarm, etc... You can also hear the occasional subway car and the traffic cop blowing his/her whistle... No one was in the lobby at 4:50am when we went to check out which I thought was odd and no one would answer a phone... so we just left the keys in the drop with a note... If you plan to spend 8 hours a day in your room (just enough to sleep and/or whatever), then this is a good cost-effective place to stay. $92/night. If you like hanging in your room, don't stay here. Anyways... Check out the restaurant next to the hotel named Yolk... Good breakfast and kind of art/deco!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, Good Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: iscllee
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 day stay at the BW Grant Plaza. I was initially concerned after reading some not so positive reviews. But if you don't have high expectations, i.e you don't expect the Ritz Carlton, this is great a little hotel in the Windy City. I stayed on the 7th floor and had pretty decent views of the city skyline and Lake Michigan. The rooms were clean and adequately decorated. I was there for a conference and appreciated that each room had an ironing board and iron. The heater some reviewers complained about, worked just fine in my room. In fact, I had a brand new heater/AC unit. Connecting to the complimentary Wi-Fi was a cinch. Only disappointment was the lack of breakfast. The restaurant next door was rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, did the job!”
Reviews.Author: MarieEire
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends, went to Chicago for 3 days in June 2006, as part of our world trip. The hotel was easy to find since we printed up maps. Easy check in, spacious room for the 4 of us: 2 queen size beds. We wanted to save money so we all shared! Breakfast was in the lobby, basic, croissants, muffins, bagels, tea, coffee, juice. all nice but nowhere to eat properly, we had to stand around in the lobby eating. We knew we weren't in a fancy hotel so it was fine. We found all the sights were in walking distance, the museum, park, sears tower, wrigley stadium, the wharf, the main shopping areas! We had no problems, the pool was very cold but that was fine since it was very hot! Only down point was that it's not near the night life, but if your not there for that it's good!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, clean with a view of the lake”
Reviews.Author: Marliroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of Thanksgiving and the mid-week rate was great. The room was clean and had a view of the park and the lake-even from the side street. This is a small hotel compared to others downtown, and the only major problem that we had was that the internet service was virtually non-existent. Despite asking them every day if it was fixed, they kept saying their technician was going to work on it.....but it never worked. The weekend rate rises to a ridiculous amount, so we opted to drive to Michigan City instead, although we saw that the Hilton a couple of blocks up the street actually had a cheaper rate ($109) on the weekend, but that was for a room without a view. The staff is professional and the lobby is small but functional. A new restaurant in the front of the building had so-so coffee drinks, and sweet rolls at their walk-up counter. The hotel also offers their $13 breakfast which we did not get. Instead we just got a sweet roll and coffee and walked through the park across the street. We found a great little espresso/bakery shop in the other direction-away from the lake which we will return to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: upnorth777
Reviews.Content: Despite all of the negative reviews I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. The rate was reasonable compared to most others in Downtown. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and it was within walking distance of all of the major musems and the L. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: dialuna70
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for the night of November 7th, 2006. When I arrived at the hotel, the person at the front desk told me that my room had been flooded by a pipe bursting the night before. As a result of that, they were going to move me to another Best Western property uptown, pay for the night, ad also for the taxi fare (an additional $10 but a nice gesture). The room at the other property was more expensive by $20. I did not stay at the Best Western Grant Park, but I am definitely impressed by their customer service and their very nice handling of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “expected the worst...”
Reviews.Author: Tinga
Reviews.Content: ...But, on arrival was pleasantly surprised. Stayed for 4 nights, and my only gripe would be the noisy heater! It was very cold for a few nights, and when the heater went on, it wasnt exactly quiet.. but i just ended up turning it off. The hotel is a little dated, but in all honesty, far better than i had imagined. We were told that we had to buy breakfast,and at the hotel it was approx$15,dont do it! get your walking shoes on, head straight up michigan ave, and about 6 blocks up, is the corner bakery! Have the oatmeal.. it was to die for, and only about$2.50. think we had 2 oatmeals fruit and coffee and it was $10..bargain. Dont miss the cloud gate sculpture in the park opposite the cafe.. go on a sunny day, and at night, its amazing. Back to the hotel, it is a bit out of the city, but taxis are freequent and cheap, or like we did.. walk. you get a feel for the place if you walk.. loved it in chicago. try eating at the Downtown, on wabash..with a view of the loop, inside and out.. the burgers were awesome. sears tower was ok, but its all inside, no viewing platform. enjoy chicago.. we did

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: portabello
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location, directly across from Grant Park & easy walking to shopping & buses. A tired hotel, but comfortable enough. Basically our only choice for somewhere to stay as there was a huge conference on in Chicago, so we paid far more for the room than it is worth. Biggest downfall was there was no laundry. They did offer a cleaning service, but at a large cost. Also there are no self service laundromats anywhere in the vacinity, which we found out the hard way after checking on yellowpages.com & then lugging a bag of dirty clothes across town only to find a laundromat does not exist in the location. So my biggest tip, do all your washing before moving on to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is OK if you're not paying very much”
Reviews.Author: rjlink
Reviews.Content: The room is itself was OK and the location is all right, especially for the Field Museum, Soldier Field, and the Aquarium. As has been mentioned, do not plan on taking advantage of the so-called breakfast. If you want a piece of toast and a glass of juice, fine. The front desk, while pleasant, created a major hassle for me. I had borrowed a wireless network card to take advantage of the free internet, at which time my credit card was charged a deposit fee, unbeknownst to me. On check out, the front desk did not inquire whether I was returning the card, but proceeded to finalize my bill and ask for my signature. At that point I handed over the network card. They did not think to adjust the bill. I was unaware of their failure to refund the deposit until several weeks later, at which point I called and left a message for the front desk manager. No response. I sent a letter. No response. Several weeks later I called again, and talked to accounting. They promised to credit my account.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sh4ndy
Reviews.Content: Booked the cheapest hotel we could find online and were very pleasantly surprised with what we got. Staff, though busy, were helpful and friendly. Room clean, quiet and well equipped. Lobby breakfast perfectly adequate. Good location. All-in-all this hotel was great value for money and anyone who requires more than this needs to be prepared to fork out a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: otto_gumpert
Reviews.Content: We went for the Tut exhibit, so the location of this hotel couldn't have been better. The staff was helpful and friendly, and it's a great value, too. The continental breakfast was like feeding time at the zoo, but overall our stay was pleasant. Nothing to complain about here!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, good location, good service, but rundown”
Reviews.Author: virago7
Reviews.Content: Had to stay there for one night in early August for work. The staff were very helpful, but there were long lines. The free wifi is excellent, but the atmosphere is rather rundown and needs help. The elevator is very slow, especially in the morning when the various group tours were getting together. I ended up taking the stairs down to the lobby, only to find the free breakfast all gobbled up already (since their restaurant was still closed it was just coffee & crossiants in the lobby). Luckily I found Eleven City Diner around the corner and got a wonderful breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Please, please for the love of god don't stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: sammyjm
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible from the word go. To start the hotel is in such ghetto condition - I was prepared for what i pay for - but this was just simply ridulous! The lady who checked us in was kind enough to stop talking to her co-worker long enough to give us our room key and some serious attitude! After seeing the room, my husband asked me if they rent these rooms by the hour. The continental breakfast was pitiful - and that is being nice. But the finale was the best part of all - checking out! We were again greeted with less than impressive service. We had made 2 calls during our one night in hell (one local call 3 min long and one long distance - 4 min long) we were charged an exorbant $57!!! That was something like $6.50 a minute. And all we got was "we just charge you what our service provider charges us" ---. Then after trying to reason with them and maybe half - they charged us even though we refused to sign the form - WHICH IS ILLEGAL - and received a lovely --- you from the Manager. Yes he actually said that to us - I was floored. The was another manager there from Florida and he was just disgusted. We are following up with this claim - also wot.if (the place we booked through) has taken them off their recommendations list. That is all

Reviews.Title: “Not just a great location...”
Reviews.Author: FarFromWI
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Best Western Grant Park. All of the staff we encountered were polite, respectful and very knowledgable about the city. Even the valet who parked my car was a gem! When I forgot my camera and he went back to look for it and couldn't find it; he brought the car back down to the street for me to search it out. Our room was great, clean and comfortable. A little bit of a view (the first time I was there I stayed on the Columbia College side of the building and got to watch some dancers warming up -- how voyeuristic -- and fun!). All in all a great experience and a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: FWjaunt
Reviews.Content: As many have said, great location, near museums and el. Some complained about the service--I had no lines and excellent service. When I called about a light out in my room, maintenance was up in two minutes. They pointed out a nearby Subway shop and Kinks with internet service. Towels weren't fluffy and there was some street noise, but not really a problem./

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews saying that the beds were awful and that the staff was rude and unhelpful. I considered changing my reservations, but decided that since I booked based on location, I would keep my reservation because of location. I am very glad I decided to keep them. Let me just say that the hotel staff went above and beyond! They were great! Every interaction we had with a staff member impressed me! The beds were okay, and did not seem to sag in the middle (at least in rooms 803 and 619) as stated in multiple reviews of the hotel. Our only small complaint was...the pool was ICE cold! But it was deep, so once our bodies went numb we had a great time! If you want some of the free breakfast make sure to get down there early, because once it is gone you are out of luck. =) I honestly cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. They were great, we all joked around. And we brought them treats from the taste of Chicago. Grant Park is right down the street and the museum campus was right across the street so we had easy access to the Shedd!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Overall Stay in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blueeyedguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and was less expensive than many of its neighbors. The Roosevelt St. "L" station is two blocks away. You could access the rest of the city from here. The Metra commuter rail station, about two blocks east, is another public transit option to distant attractions like the Museum of Science and Industry and the Chicago Botanic Garden. Grant Park is right across the street. The Field Museum, Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium and Soldier Field are just beyond that. There are several restaurants, groceries and drugstores within walking distance too. Another restaurant appeared to be under construction in the same building as the BW. As for the hotel itself, the exterior is pretty dated and in need of remodeling. The outdoor pool on the third floor was clean but unheated. My room was mostly clean but the carpeting was wrinkled and worn. There was what appeared to be a big booger stuck to the carpet. Repeated vacuuming by housekeeping didn't remove it. The lobby was more modern. The continental breakfast consisted of muffins, donuts, pastries, pop tarts, bagels, coffee, OJ and milk. Free Chicago Tribune newspapers were available every weekday morning. My only major complaints were that one of the two elevators broke down the day I arrived and was still out of order when I left five days later. The waits were so long that I often ended up walking up or down nine flights of stairs. Secondly, housekeeping never got to my room until around 4:30 pm. This was very inconvenient as I always seemed to be returning from sightseeing at about this time. Despite these issues, I probably would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value despite previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: djulster
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I was a bit weary about staying here. however I cannot really fault the hotel too much. The staff were friendly and helpful and whilst the location isn't the best, it is only a 10 minute walk from Soldier Field where I was attending a match and about 3 minutes from the Roosevelt El train station which gets you downtown in about 5-10 minutes. The room was of an average size and was clean and cleaned thoroughly every day. I was never up for the ' Compliementary Continental Breakfast' however it seemed a bit odd to be having this in the lobby as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. The swimming pool was closed when I was there, which was annoying as it was staring to get really hot but 'Seasonal' appears to mean opening after Memorial Day. All in all good value with little to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Ya get what ya pay for”
Reviews.Author: lmnopEaganMN
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago March 25th 2006. We wanted a great location for a little money. I was pleasantly surpised at the BW Grant Park. We too experienced a too-long wait at the front desk, but when it's your turn they do pay attention to you. We dealt with Octavio on a couple occasions and he was very helpful and nice. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The soaps and shampoos in our room were replaced each morning we were there. We were on the Lake side and I am glad. Great view of the park, the Shedd, the Field and Adler Planetarium, which are easy to walk to. You'll have to take the bus to Science & Industry but it's an express and it gets you the closest. As for anywhere else in the city the Roosevelt station is just a couple blocks away. As another reviewer mentioned there are aggravations. The restaurant was under renovation, so they did offer free continental breakfast of donuts, pastry, bagels, watery OJ and coffee...and good luck finding a place to sit in the small lobby to eat it. We ended up going in shifts to carry enough upstairs to eat in our room; no trays were offered so be careful balancing that donut on top of your coffee cup while you push the elevator button :) Also, when we checked in during the late afternoon on Saturday the hotel's valet lot was full. My husband headed around the corner to the public ramp. It was more expensive. But, they did let us walk up to the car to get the stuff we needed. But, they didn't open until 9am, so it pushed our itinerary back while we waited. We left the car there the whole time and used public transport exclusively; way easier than driving in Chi-town! The location was GREAT and I'd definitely put up with the aggravations again. Next door is a tiny grocery called Clancy's (I think?) and they have the water, snacks, newspapers etc that we all need to get through the day. Also they have the visitor one day transit passes that cost $5 and are good for El and buses...super easy to use and easy to stop in to buy.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: FKAPUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not as bad as reviews had made it out to be. I arrived and was greeted by a friendly woman on the front desk, and all staff were always very helpful and always smiling. The only problem I had with my room was with a light which broke, and the guy at the front desk said he'd have someone fix it. I had been in the room less than 2 minutes when an electrician showed up and fixed the light. That was good service. The hotel is also really well located. It faces Grant Park and Lake Michigan, and its location on S. Michigan Avenue is wonderful - only a 10-minute stroll into the Loop, or, if you're lazy like me, one stop on the El from Roosevelt station, which is just 1 block away from the hotel. The free breakfast was also great, as was the coffee on tap. However, there were some problems with the hotel. Firstly, the temperature control in the room was done by a big, clunky and old fan unit. Which means that every time the temperature drops below the thermostat level, the whole thing shudders into action and really noisily pumps air into the room. This was sufficient to wake me up several times per night. Secondly, the thermostat controls did not make sense. When I tried to use them, they came apart and I found that there was an unhealthy-looking little vial of mercury strapped to the inside with tape. But the one thing which was not welcome was the fact that soaps/shampoos were not replaced. I was at the hotel for several nights and found that after the first night, hotel soaps and shampoos which I used were not replaced, meaning that every night I had to walk down to reception to get soap and things.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Complain Much But....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The line to get anything done at the front desk took forever. When we checked in, when we tried to get a valet, when we needed new keys, and when we checked out took forever. Then while we are standing in line to check out some loser comes up and goes "I just want to check out" and cuts in front of us. Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, decent location, reasonable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AberChris
Reviews.Content: One of the cheaper hotels near Downtown Chicago, so quite an attractive tourist option. If you're wanting to spend most of your time around the Magnificent Mile, you could probably find more convenient places, although it's almost next to the Museum Campus, the Symphony Hall and a few theatres, so it depends what your priorities are. It's also just round the corner from the Roosevelt CTA station, so it's quite easy to get around by public transport. The hotel's a pretty typical chain-type. My room was good - very big with a desk, arm chair, bed-side table with clock radio, plenty lights, a coffee machine, a good tv and a good bathroom. The only problem with my room was the heating/air conditioning. It was quite cold without heating but it's a fan heater and quite a noisy one, so you couldn't keep it on at night. Another downside was the breakfast. While it was good that some form of complimentary breakfast was provided, it was a bit haphazard! On my first day it was very nice - a decent selection of croissant, toast, egg muffins and pastries, with orange juice, tea/coffee and jam. However, on the other days I was there, at least one of those was generally unavailable. Croissants with no butter or jam, for instance. And Out of 5 days, orange juice was only there on 2. So don't go expecting a feast!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Author: ladyrebecka
Reviews.Content: After traveling four hours to an area we were unfamiliar with, we called the hotel for directions. They told us to get out of the area we were in but were unable to give us directions to do that...."just get out at a gas station and ask." was the response. Hello, two women and two children in an area where there are bars on every window. Sorry I'm familiar with what happens in Detroit if you get out. When we finally did manage to get to the hotel, we learned that valet parking was extra and that's all that was offered. The heat from the room blew us across the hall. What idiot in their right mind sleeps in a room that is 67 degrees unless it is summer time? Did I mention that the people in the next room tried to come through the adjoining door after we got settled into bed? Then there was the room, it was hardly bigger than a closet and there was no room to move around. And if there was a restaurant, it sure didn't open early enough for us to get any breakfast. Where are the luggage carriers? it sure would have helped with check out. NEVER again.
